value.name: AzureVmssDeployment
value.description: Deploy Virtual Machine scale set image
value.releaseNotes: - Updates Azure Virtual Machine scale set with a custom machine image.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: StartupConfiguration
groups.visibleRule: action = Configure application startup || action = Update image || action = UpdateImage

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the scale set.

options.Update image: Update VM Scale set by using an image
options.Configure application startup: Run Custom Script VM extension on VM scale set

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Choose between updating a VM scale set by using a VHD image and/or by running deployment/install scripts using Custom Script VM extension.
The VHD image approach is better for scaling quickly and doing rollback. The extension approach is useful for post deployment configuration, software installation, or any other configuration / management task.
You can use a VHD image to update a VM scale set only when it was created by using a custom image, the update will fail if the VM Scale set was created by using a platform/gallery image available in Azure.
The Custom script VM extension approach can be used for VM scale set created by using either custom image or platform/gallery image.

inputs.name: vmssName
inputs.label: Virtual Machine scale set name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of VM scale set which you want to update by using either a VHD image or by using Custom script VM extension.

inputs.name: vmssOsType
inputs.label: OS type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the operating system type of VM scale set.

inputs.name: imageUrl
inputs.label: Image URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the URL of VHD image. If it is an Azure storage blob URL, the storage account location should be same as scale set location.

inputs.name: customScriptsDirectory
inputs.label: Custom script directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to directory containing custom script(s) that will be run by using Custom Script VM extension. The extension approach is useful for post deployment configuration, application/software installation, or any other application configuration/management task. For example: the script can set a machine level environment variable which the application uses, like database connection string.

inputs.name: customScript
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The script that will be run by using Custom Script VM extension. This script can invoke other scripts in the directory. The script will be invoked with arguments passed below.
This script in conjugation with such arguments can be used to execute commands. For example:
1. Update-DatabaseConnectionStrings.ps1 -clusterType dev -user $(dbUser) -password $(dbUserPwd) will update connection string in web.config of web application.
2. install-secrets.sh --key-vault-type prod -key serviceprincipalkey will create an encrypted file containing service principal key.

inputs.name: customScriptArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The custom script will be invoked with arguments passed. Build/Release variables can be used which makes it easy to use secrets.

inputs.name: customScriptsStorageAccount
inputs.label: Azure storage account where custom scripts will be uploaded
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Custom Script Extension downloads and executes scripts provided by you on each virtual machines in the VM scale set. These scripts will be stored in the storage account specified here. Specify a pre-existing ARM storage account.

inputs.name: skipArchivingCustomScripts
inputs.label: Skip Archiving custom scripts
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, this task creates a compressed archive of directory containing custom scripts. This improves performance and reliability while uploading to azure storage. If not selected, archiving will not be done and all files will be inidividually uploaded.

value.name: XamariniOS
value.description: Build an iOS app with Xamarin on macOS
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root of the Xamarin.iOS solution to build. May contain wildcards.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Standard configurations are Ad-Hoc, AppStore, Debug, Release.

inputs.name: clean
inputs.label: Clean
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run a clean build (/t:clean) prior to the build.

inputs.name: packageApp
inputs.label: Create app package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether an IPA should be generated as a part of the build.

inputs.name: forSimulator
inputs.label: Build for iOS Simulator
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally build for the iOS Simulator instead of physical iOS devices.

inputs.name: runNugetRestore
inputs.label: Run NuGet restore
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally run `nuget restore` on the Xamarin iOS solution to install all referenced packages before build. The 'nuget' tool in the PATH of the build agent machine will be used. To use a different version of NuGet or set additional arguments, use the [NuGet Installer Task](https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/build/steps/package/nuget-installer).

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional command line arguments that should be used to build.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory in which builds will run. When empty, the root of the repository is used.

inputs.name: mdtoolLocation
inputs.label: Build tool path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to xbuild (the Xamarin Studio mono build tool) or MSBuild (the Visual Studio for Mac build tool). When empty, the default xbuild or MSBuild path is used.

inputs.name: signMethod
inputs.label: Override using
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the build should use a signing or provisioning method that is different than the default, choose that method here. Choose 'File Contents' to use a P12 certificate and provisioning profile. Choose 'Identifiers' to retrieve signing settings from the default Keychain and pre-installed profiles. Leave the corresponding fields blank if you do not wish to override default build settings.

inputs.name: iosSigningIdentity
inputs.label: Signing identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally override the signing identity that will be used to sign the build. If nothing is entered, the setting in the Xcode project will be used. You may need to select 'Unlock Default Keychain' if you use this option.

inputs.name: unlockDefaultKeychain
inputs.label: Unlock default keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Resolve "User interaction is not allowed" errors by unlocking the default keychain.

inputs.name: defaultKeychainPassword
inputs.label: Default keychain password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to unlock the default keychain when that option is set.

inputs.name: provProfileUuid
inputs.label: Provisioning profile UUID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build.

inputs.name: p12
inputs.label: P12 certificate file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to a PKCS12-formatted P12 certificate file containing a signing certificate to be used for this build.

inputs.name: p12pwd
inputs.label: P12 password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to the P12 certificate file, if specified. Use a build variable to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: provProfile
inputs.label: Provisioning profile file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to a file containing the provisioning profile override to be used for this build.

inputs.name: removeProfile
inputs.label: Remove profile after build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies that the contents of the provisioning profile file should be removed from the build agent after the build is complete. **Only enable this if you are running one agent per user.**

value.name: XamarinTestCloud
value.description: [Depreciated] Testing mobile apps with Xamarin Test Cloud using Xamarin.UITest - recommended task is now AppCenterTest
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: app
inputs.label: App file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the app(s) to test.  Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)).  For example, `**/*.apk` for all APK files in all subfolders.

inputs.name: dsym
inputs.label: dSYM file (iOS only)
inputs.helpMarkDown: To make crash logs easier to read, you can upload a dSYM file that is associated with your app. This field only applies to iOS apps. Provide path relative to the .ipa file. Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)). For example: *.dSYM

inputs.name: teamApiKey
inputs.label: Team API key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Your Xamarin Test Cloud Team API key can be found under "Teams & Apps" at https://testcloud.xamarin.com/account.

inputs.name: user
inputs.label: User email
inputs.helpMarkDown: User name this test will run under.

inputs.name: devices
inputs.label: Devices
inputs.helpMarkDown: The devices string is generated by Xamarin Test Cloud. It can be found as the value of the --devices command line argument of a Test Cloud test run.

inputs.name: series
inputs.label: Series
inputs.helpMarkDown: The series name for organizing test runs (e.g. master, production, beta).

inputs.name: testDir
inputs.label: Test assembly directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path to the folder containing the test assemblies, such as: SolutionName/TestsProjectName/bin/Release

inputs.name: locale
inputs.label: System language
inputs.helpMarkDown: If your language isn't displayed, select 'Other' and enter its locale below, such as en_US.

inputs.name: userDefinedLocale
inputs.label: Other locale
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter any two-letter ISO-639 language code along with any two-letter ISO 3166 country code in the format [language]_[country], such as en_US.

inputs.name: testCloudLocation
inputs.label: test-cloud.exe location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to test-cloud.exe.  Wildcards can be used, in which case the first occurrence of test-cloud.exe is used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)).

inputs.name: optionalArgs
inputs.label: Optional arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to test-cloud.exe.

inputs.name: publishNUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish results to TFS/Team Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: When selected, --nunit-xml option will be passed to test-cloud.exe. Results from the NUnit xml file will be published to TFS/Team Services.

value.instanceNameFormat: Test $(app) with Xamarin.UITest in Xamarin Test Cloud

value.helpMarkDown: For help with this task, visit the Visual Studio App Center [support site](https://aka.ms/appcentersupport/).

inputs.name: appSlug
inputs.label: App slug
inputs.helpMarkDown: The app slug is in the format of **{username}/{app_identifier}**. To locate **{username}** and **{app_identifier}** for an app, click on its name from https://appcenter.ms/apps, and the resulting URL is in the format of [https://appcenter.ms/users/{username}/apps/{app_identifier}](https://appcenter.ms/users/{username}/apps/{app_identifier}). If you are using orgs, the app slug is of the format **{orgname}/{app_identifier}**.

inputs.name: pdbPath
inputs.label: Symbols path (*.pdb)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repo root to PDB symbols files. Path may contain wildcards.

inputs.name: dsymPath
inputs.label: dSYM path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repo root to dSYM folder. Path may contain wildcards.

inputs.name: mappingTxtPath
inputs.label: Mapping file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repo root to Android's mapping.txt file.

inputs.name: packParentFolder
inputs.label: Include all items in parent folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upload the selected symbols file or folder and all other items inside the same parent folder. This is required for React Native apps.

inputs.name: releaseNotesInput
inputs.label: Release notes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Release notes for this version.

inputs.name: releaseNotesFile
inputs.label: Release notes file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a UTF-8 encoded text file which contains the Release Notes for this version.

inputs.name: destinationId
inputs.label: Destination ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID of the distribution group or store the app will deploy to. Leave it empty to use the default group.

value.instanceNameFormat: Deploy $(app) to Visual Studio App Center

inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to sign the APK with a provided keystore file. Unsigned APKs can only run in an emulator. APKs must be signed to run on a device.

inputs.name: keystoreFile
inputs.label: Keystore file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the keystore file that was uploaded to `Secure Files` to be used to sign the APK.

inputs.name: keystorePass
inputs.label: Keystore password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the password for the provided keystore file. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: keystoreAlias
inputs.label: Alias
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the alias that identifies the public/private key pair to be used in the keystore file.

inputs.name: keyPass
inputs.label: Key password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the key password for the alias and keystore file. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: jarsignerArguments
inputs.label: Jarsigner arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide any options to pass to the jarsigner command line. Default is: -verbose -sigalg MD5withRSA -digestalg SHA1

inputs.name: zipalign
inputs.label: Zipalign
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you want to zipalign your package. This reduces the amount of RAM consumed by an app.

inputs.name: zipalignLocation
inputs.label: Zipalign location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the location of the zipalign executable used during signing. This defaults to the zipalign found in the Android SDK version folder that your application builds against.

value.name: WindowsMachineFileCopy
value.description: Copy files to remote machine(s)
value.releaseNotes:
What's new in Version 2.0:
  Proxy support is being added.
   Removed support of legacy DTL machines.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: SourcePath
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path of the source folder or file on the local machine, or a UNC Share like c:\fabrikamfiber or \\\\fabrikamshare\fabrikamfiber.

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,192.168.12.34
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for administrator login for the target machines.
It can accept a variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark the variable as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local Path on the target machines or an accessible UNC path for copying the files from the source like d:\fabrikam or \\\\fabrikam\Web.

inputs.name: CleanTargetBeforeCopy
inputs.label: Clean Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting it will clean the destination folder before copying the files.

inputs.name: CopyFilesInParallel
inputs.label: Copy Files in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting it will copy files in parallel to the machines.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional robocopy arguments that will be applied when copying files like, /min:33553332 /l.

value.name: WindowsMachineFileCopy

Password for administrator login for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local Path on the target machines or an accessible UNC path for copying the files from the source like d:\fabrikam or \\\\fabrikam\Web.

inputs.name: CleanTargetBeforeCopy

inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting it will clean the destination folder before copying the files.

inputs.name: CopyFilesInParallel

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional robocopy arguments that will be applied when copying files like, /min:33553332 /l.

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Filter Criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: This input is valid only for machine groups and is not supported for flat list of machines or output variables yet. Provide a list of machines like, dbserver.fabrikam.com, webserver.fabrikam.com, 192.168.12.34, or tags like, Role:DB; OS:Win8.1. If multiple tags are provided, then the task will run in all the machines with the specified tags. The default is to run the task in all machines.

value.name: DeleteFiles
value.description: Delete files or folders. (The minimatch patterns will only match file paths, not folder paths)
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: SourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder that the deletion(s) will be run from.  Empty is the root of the repo.  Use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) if files are not in the repo. Example: $(agent.builddirectory)

inputs.name: Contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: File/folder paths to delete. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns. [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=722333)

value.name: Chef
value.description: Deploy to Chef environments by editing environment attributes
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Chef Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Chef subscription service connection.

inputs.name: Environment
inputs.label: Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Chef Environment to be used for Deployment. The attributes of that environment will be edited.

inputs.name: Attributes
inputs.label: Environment Attributes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the value of the leaf node attribute(s) to be updated. Example. { "default_attributes.connectionString" : "$(connectionString)", "override_attributes.buildLocation" : "https://sample.blob.core.windows.net/build" }. Task fails if the leaf node does not exist.

inputs.name: chefWaitTime
inputs.label: Wait Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: The amount of time (in minutes) to wait for this task to complete. Default value: 30 minutes

value.instanceNameFormat: Deploy to chef by editing environment attributes of Chef subscription $(ChefServer)

outputVariables.name: pythonLocation
outputVariables.description: The directory of the installed Python distribution. Use this in subsequent tasks to access this installation of Python.

value.name: UsePythonVersion
value.description: Retrieves the specified version of Python from the tool cache. Optionally add it to PATH.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version range or exact version of a Python version to use.

inputs.name: addToPath
inputs.label: Add to PATH
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to prepend the retrieved Python version to the PATH environment variable to make it available in subsequent tasks or scripts without using the output variable.

inputs.name: architecture
inputs.label: Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target architecture (x86, x64) of the Python interpreter.

value.name: ServiceFabricComposeDeploy
value.description: Deploy a docker-compose application to a Service Fabric cluster.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: serviceConnectionName
inputs.label: Cluster Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Service Fabric service connection to be used to connect to the cluster. Choose 'Manage' to register a new service connection.

inputs.name: composeFilePath
inputs.label: Compose File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the compose file that is to be deployed. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path.

inputs.name: applicationName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the application being deployed.

inputs.name: registryCredentials
inputs.label: Registry Credentials Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose if/how credentials for the docker registry will be provided.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpointName
inputs.label: Docker Registry Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. If a certificate matching the Server Certificate Thumbprint in the Cluster Service Connection is installed on the build agent, it will be used to encrypt the password; otherwise the password will not be encrypted.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription

inputs.name: registryUserName
inputs.label: Registry User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username for the Docker registry

inputs.name: registryPassword
inputs.label: Registry Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the Docker registry. If the password is not encrypted, it is recommended that you use a custom release pipeline secret variable to store it.

inputs.name: passwordEncrypted
inputs.label: Password Encrypted
inputs.helpMarkDown: It is recommended to encrypt your password using [Invoke-ServiceFabricEncryptText](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-application-secret-management#encrypt-application-secrets). If you do not, and a certificate matching the Server Certificate Thumbprint in the Cluster Service Connection is installed on the build agent, it will be used to encrypt the password; otherwise an error will occur.

inputs.name: upgrade
inputs.label: Upgrade
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upgrade an existing deployment rather than removing it.

inputs.name: deployTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Deploy Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for deploying the application.

inputs.name: removeTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Remove Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for removing an existing application.

inputs.name: getStatusTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Get Status Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for getting the status of an existing application.

value.instanceNameFormat: Deploy Compose Application to Service Fabric

value.name: DockerCompose
value.description: Build, push or run multi-container Docker applications. Task can be used with Docker or Azure Container registry.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: containerregistrytype
inputs.label: Container Registry Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Container Registry Type.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: dockerComposeFile
inputs.label: Docker Compose File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the primary Docker Compose file to use.

inputs.name: additionalDockerComposeFiles
inputs.label: Additional Docker Compose Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Docker Compose files to be combined with the primary Docker Compose file. Relative paths are resolved relative to the directory containing the primary Docker Compose file. If a specified file is not found, it is ignored. Specify each file path on a new line.

inputs.name: dockerComposeFileArgs
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Environment variables to be set during the command. Specify each name=value pair on a new line.

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Project name used for default naming of images and containers.

inputs.name: qualifyImageNames
inputs.label: Qualify Image Names
inputs.helpMarkDown: Qualify image names for built services with the Docker registry service connection's hostname if not otherwise specified.

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker Compose action.

inputs.name: additionalImageTags
inputs.label: Additional Image Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional tags for the Docker images being built or pushed.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build services || action = Push services

inputs.name: includeSourceTags
inputs.label: Include Source Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include Git tags when building or pushing Docker images.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build services || action = Push services

inputs.name: includeLatestTag
inputs.label: Include Latest Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include the 'latest' tag when building or pushing Docker images.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build services || action = Push services

inputs.name: buildImages
inputs.label: Build Images
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build images before starting service containers.

inputs.name: serviceName
inputs.label: Service Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the specific service to run.

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the specific service container to run.

inputs.name: ports
inputs.label: Ports
inputs.helpMarkDown: Ports in the specific service container to publish to the host. Specify each host-port:container-port binding on a new line.

inputs.name: workDir
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory for the specific service container.

inputs.name: entrypoint
inputs.label: Entry Point Override
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override the default entry point for the specific service container.

inputs.name: containerCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Command to run in the specific service container. For example, if the image contains a simple Python Flask web application you can specify 'python app.py' to launch the web application.

inputs.name: detached
inputs.label: Run in Background
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the service containers in the background.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Run services || action = Run a specific service

inputs.name: abortOnContainerExit
inputs.label: Abort on Container Exit
inputs.helpMarkDown: Stop all containers when any container exits.

inputs.name: imageDigestComposeFile
inputs.label: Image Digest Compose File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a Docker Compose file that is created and populated with the full image repository digests of each service's Docker image.

inputs.name: removeBuildOptions
inputs.label: Remove Build Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Remove the build options from the output Docker Compose file.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Lock services || action = Combine configuration

inputs.name: baseResolveDirectory
inputs.label: Base Resolve Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The base directory from which relative paths in the output Docker Compose file should be resolved.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Lock services || action = Combine configuration

inputs.name: outputDockerComposeFile
inputs.label: Output Docker Compose File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to an output Docker Compose file.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Lock services || action = Combine configuration

inputs.name: dockerComposeCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Docker Compose command to execute with arguments. For example, 'rm --all' to remove all stopped service containers.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Run a Docker Compose command

inputs.name: dockerHostEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Host Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker host service connection. Defaults to the agent's host.

inputs.name: nopIfNoDockerComposeFile
inputs.label: No-op if no Docker Compose File
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the Docker Compose file does not exist, skip this task. This is useful when the task offers optional behavior based on the existence of a Docker Compose file in the repository.

inputs.name: requireAdditionalDockerComposeFiles
inputs.label: Require Additional Docker Compose Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Produces an error if the additional Docker Compose files do not exist. This overrides the default behavior which is to ignore a file if it does not exist.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for the Docker Compose command.

value.name: NuGetToolInstaller
value.description: Acquires a specific version of NuGet from the internet or the tools cache and adds it to the PATH. Use this step to change the version of NuGet used in the NuGet steps.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version of NuGet.exe to install
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A version or version range that specifies the NuGet version to make available on the path. Use x as a wildcard. See the [list of available NuGet versions](http://dist.nuget.org/tools.json).

If you want to match a pre-release version, the specification must contain a major, minor, patch, and pre-release version from the list above.

Examples: 4.x, 3.3.x, 2.8.6, >=4.0.0-0

inputs.name: checkLatest
inputs.label: Always download the latest matching version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Always check for and download the latest available version of NuGet.exe which satisfies the version spec. This option will also always incur download time, even if the selected version of NuGet is already cached.

Enabling this option could cause unexpected build breaks when a new version of NuGet is released.

value.name: Gradle
value.description: Build using a Gradle wrapper script
value.releaseNotes: Configuration of the SonarQube analysis was moved to the [SonarQube](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarqube) or [SonarCloud](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarcloud) extensions, in task `Prepare Analysis Configuration`
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: wrapperScript
inputs.label: Gradle wrapper
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the Gradle Wrapper script.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory in which to run the Gradle build. If not specified, the repository root directory is used.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to TFS/Team Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Gradle build to TFS/Team Services. Each test results file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in TFS/Team Services.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)). For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: codeCoverageTool
inputs.label: Code coverage tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the code coverage tool.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of directories containing class files and archive files (JAR, WAR, etc.). Code coverage is reported for class files in these directories. Normally, classes under `build/classes/main` are searched, which is the default class directory for Gradle builds

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class inclusion/exclusion filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example: +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*.

inputs.name: failIfCoverageEmpty
inputs.label: Fail when code coverage results are missing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if code coverage did not produce any results to publish.

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of the JDK.

inputs.name: gradleOpts
inputs.label: Set GRADLE_OPTS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets the GRADLE_OPTS environment variable, which is used to send command-line arguments to start the JVM. The xmx flag specifies the maximum memory available to the JVM.

inputs.name: sqAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run SonarQube or SonarCloud Analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option has changed from version 1 of the **Gradle** task to use the [SonarQube](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarqube) and [SonarCloud](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarcloud) marketplace extensions. Enable this option to run [SonarQube or SonarCloud analysis](http://redirect.sonarsource.com/doc/install-configure-scanner-tfs-ts.html) after executing tasks in the **Tasks** field. You must also add a **Prepare Analysis Configuration** task from one of the extensions to the build pipeline before this Gradle task.

options.build: Use plugin applied in your build.gradle

inputs.name: sqGradlePluginVersionChoice
inputs.label: SonarQube scanner for Gradle version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube Gradle plugin version to use. You can declare it in your Gradle configuration file, or specify a version here.

inputs.name: sqGradlePluginVersion
inputs.label: SonarQube scanner for Gradle plugin version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Refer to https://plugins.gradle.org/plugin/org.sonarqube for all available versions.

inputs.name: checkstyleAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run Checkstyle
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the Checkstyle tool with the default Sun checks. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: findbugsAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run FindBugs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the FindBugs static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: pmdAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run PMD
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the PMD Java static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: checkstyleAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run Checkstyle
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the Checkstyle tool with the default Sun checks. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: findbugsAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run FindBugs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the FindBugs static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: pmdAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run PMD
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the PMD Java static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

value.name: SSH
value.description: Run shell commands or a script on a remote machine using SSH
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: sshEndpoint
inputs.label: SSH service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: SSH service connection with connection details for the remote machine.

inputs.name: runOptions
inputs.label: Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to either run shell commands or a shell script on the remote machine.

inputs.name: commands
inputs.label: Commands
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the shell commands to run on the remote machine. Enter each command along with its arguments on a new line. To run multiple commands together, enter them on the same line separated by semi-colons (e.g. cd /home/user/myFolder;build).

inputs.name: scriptPath
inputs.label: Shell script path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the shell script file to run on the remote machine.

inputs.name: inline
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Write the shell script to run on the remote machine.

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to pass to the shell script.

inputs.name: failOnStdErr
inputs.label: Fail on STDERR
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, the build will fail when the remote commands or script write to STDERR.

value.name: CloudLoadTest
value.description: Runs the load test in the cloud with Visual Studio Team Services
value.helpMarkDown: This task triggers a cloud-based load test using Visual Studio Team Services. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=546976)
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: VS Team Services Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a previously registered service connection to talk to the cloud-based load test service. Choose 'Manage' to register a new service connection.

inputs.name: TestDrop
inputs.label: Load test files folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Output path where the load test and supporting files including plugins and data files are available.
  • Build Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\LoadTestproject\bin\$(BuildConfiguration)
  • Release Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\SourceCI\drop\LoadTestproject\bin\Release
    where SourceCI is the source alias and drop is artifact name

inputs.name: LoadTest
inputs.label: Load test file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The load test filename to be used from the load test files folder specified.

options.useFile: As specified in the load test file

inputs.name: activeRunSettings
inputs.label: Active Run Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the active run settings as specified in the file (values can be overridden) or change the active run setting for the load test file.

inputs.name: runSettingName
inputs.label: Specify the name of the Run Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the run setting that will be made active

inputs.name: testContextParameters
inputs.label: Override load test context parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override test context parameters defined in the load test. For example: `-parameter1 value1 -parameter2 "value with spaces"

inputs.name: TestSettings
inputs.label: Test settings file
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The testsettings file name to be used from the load test folder specified above or a full path.
  • Build Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\LoadTestproject\bin\$(BuildConfiguration)\load.testsettings
  • Release Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\SourceCI\drop\LoadTestproject\bin\Release\load.testsettings
    where SourceCI is the source alias and drop is artifact name

inputs.name: ThresholdLimit
inputs.label: Number of permissible threshold violations
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of threshold violations above which the load test outcome is considered unsuccessful.

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group rig
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of Resource group hosting the self-provisioned rig of load test agents.

inputs.name: numOfSelfProvisionedAgents
inputs.label: Number of agents to use
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of self-provisioned agents to use for this test.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName

value.name: InvokeRESTAPI
value.description: Invoke REST API as a part of your process.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Generic endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a generic endpoint that should be used to pick the url and construct authorization header for the http request.

inputs.name: method
inputs.label: Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the http method with which the API should be invoked with.

inputs.name: headers
inputs.label: Headers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define header in JSON format. The header shall be attached with request to be sent.

inputs.name: urlSuffix
inputs.label: Url suffix string
inputs.helpMarkDown: Given string append to the url. Example: If endpoint url is https:...TestProj/_apis/Release/releases and url suffix is /2/environments/1, endpoint url becomes https:.../TestProj/_apis/Release/releases/2/environments/1. If url suffix is ?definitionId=1&releaseCount=1 then endpoint url becomes https//...TestProj/_apis/Release/releases?definitionId=1&releaseCount=1.

inputs.name: waitForCompletion
inputs.label: Complete based on
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default value "ApiResponse". Available values :  "ApiResponse", "Callback" call where the REST API calls back to update the timeline record.

inputs.name: successCriteria
inputs.label: Success criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Criteria which defines when to pass the task. No criteria means response content does not influence the result. Example:- For response {"status" : "successful"}, the expression can be eq(root['status'], 'successful'). [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=842996)

value.name: InvokeRESTAPI
value.description: Invoke REST API as a part of your process.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: headers
inputs.label: Headers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define header in JSON format. The header shall be attached with request to be sent.

inputs.name: urlSuffix
inputs.label: URL suffix and parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Given string append to the URL. Example: If the service connection URL is https:...TestProj/_apis/Release/releases and the URL suffix is /2/environments/1, the service connection URL becomes https:.../TestProj/_apis/Release/releases/2/environments/1. If the URL suffix is ?definitionId=1&releaseCount=1 then the service connection URL becomes https//...TestProj/_apis/Release/releases?definitionId=1&releaseCount=1.

inputs.name: waitForCompletion

Example:- For response {"status" : "successful"}, the expression can be eq(root['status'], 'successful'). [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=842996)

value.name: SqlDacpacDeploymentOnMachineGroup
value.description: Deploy to SQL Server Database using DACPAC or SQL scripts
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: TaskType
inputs.label: Deploy SQL Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the way in which you want to deploy DB, either by using Dacpac or by using Sql Script.

inputs.name: DacpacFile
inputs.label: DACPAC File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the DACPAC file on the target machines or on a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.dacpac. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported, like $env:windir, $env:systemroot, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\DB. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/*.dacpac` for DACPAC file present in all sub folders.

inputs.name: SqlFile
inputs.label: Sql File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the SQL file on the target. Provide semi-colon separated list of SQL script files to execute multiple files. The SQL scripts will be executed in the order given. Location can also be a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.sql. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported, like $env:windir, $env:systemroot, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\DB. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/*.sql` for sql file present in all sub folders.

inputs.name: ExecuteInTransaction
inputs.label: Execute within a transaction
inputs.helpMarkDown: Executes SQL script(s) within a transaction

inputs.name: ExclusiveLock
inputs.label: Acquire an exclusive app lock while executing script(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Acquires an exclusive app lock while executing script(s)

inputs.name: AppLockName
inputs.label: App lock name
inputs.helpMarkDown: App lock name

inputs.name: InlineSql
inputs.label: Inline Sql
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sql Queries inline

inputs.name: TargetMethod
inputs.label: Specify SQL Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the option to connect to the target SQL Server Database. The options are either to provide the SQL Server Database details, or the SQL Server connection string, or the Publish profile XML file.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SQL Server name like, machinename\FabriakmSQL,1433 or localhost or .\SQL2012R2. Specifying localhost will connect to the Default SQL Server instance on the machine.
inputs.visibleRule: TargetMethod = server || TaskType = sqlQuery || TaskType = sqlInline

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the SQL Server database.
inputs.visibleRule: TargetMethod = server || TaskType = sqlQuery || TaskType = sqlInline

inputs.name: AuthScheme
inputs.label: Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mode for connecting to the SQL Server. In Windows authentication mode, the administrator's account, as specified in the Machines section, is used to connect to the SQL Server. In SQL Server Authentication mode, the SQL login and Password have to be provided in the parameters below.
inputs.visibleRule: TargetMethod = server || TaskType = sqlQuery || TaskType = sqlInline

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: SQL User name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SQL login to connect to the SQL Server. The option is only available if SQL Server Authentication mode has been selected.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: SQL Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Password of the SQL login. The option is only available if SQL Server Authentication mode has been selected.

inputs.name: ConnectionString
inputs.label: Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the SQL Server connection string like "Server=localhost;Database=Fabrikam;User ID=sqluser;Password=password;".

inputs.name: PublishProfile
inputs.label: Publish Profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish profile provide fine-grained control over SQL Server database deployments. Specify the path to the Publish profile XML file on the target machine or on a UNC share that is accessible by the machine administrator's credentials.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional SqlPackage.exe arguments that will be applied when deploying the SQL Server database like, /p:IgnoreAnsiNulls=True /p:IgnoreComments=True. These arguments will override the settings in the Publish profile XML file (if provided).

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsSql
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd arguments that will be applied when deploying the SQL Server database.

value.name: FtpUpload
value.description: FTP Upload
value.helpMarkDown: Upload files to a remote machine using the File Transfer Protocol (FTP), or securely with FTPS.  [More Information](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=809084).
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: credsType
inputs.label: Authentication Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use FTP service connection or enter connection credentials.

inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: FTP Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the service connection for your FTP server. To create one, click the Manage link and create a new Generic service connection, enter the FTP server URL for the server URL, e.g. `ftp://server.example.com`, and required credentials.

Secure connections will always be made regardless of the specified protocol (`ftp://` or `ftps://`) if the target server supports FTPS. To allow only secure connections, use the `ftps://` protocol, e.g. `ftps://server.example.com`. Connections to servers not supporting FTPS will fail if `ftps://` is specified.

inputs.name: rootFolder
inputs.label: Root folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder to upload files from.

inputs.name: filePatterns
inputs.label: File patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: File paths or patterns of the files to upload.  Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns.  [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=800269)

inputs.name: remotePath
inputs.label: Remote directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upload files to this directory on the remote FTP server.

inputs.name: clean
inputs.label: Delete remote directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the remote directory including its contents before uploading.

inputs.name: cleanContents
inputs.label: Clear remote directory contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: Recursively delete all contents of the remote directory before uploading.  The existing directory will not be deleted.  For better performance, consider using `Delete remote directory` instead.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Overwrite existing files in the remote directory.

inputs.name: preservePaths
inputs.label: Preserve file paths
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If selected, the relative local directory structure is recreated under the remote directory where files are uploaded. Otherwise, files are uploaded directly to the remote directory without creating additional subdirectories.

For example, suppose your source folder is: `/home/user/source/` and contains the file: `foo/bar/foobar.txt`, and your remote directory is: `/uploads/`.
If selected, the file is uploaded to: `/uploads/foo/bar/foobar.txt`. Otherwise, to: `/uploads/foobar.txt`.

inputs.name: trustSSL
inputs.label: Trust server certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting this option results in the FTP server's SSL certificate being trusted with ftps://, even if it is self-signed or cannot be validated by a Certificate Authority (CA).

value.name: Kubernetes
value.description: Deploy, configure, update your Kubernetes cluster in Azure Container Service by running kubectl commands.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: kubernetesServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Kubernetes service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Kubernetes service connection.

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.label: Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the namespace for the kubectl command by using the namespace flag. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will run in the default namespace.

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select or specify a kubectl command to run.

inputs.name: useConfigurationFile
inputs.label: Use Configuration files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use Kubernetes configuration file with the kubectl command. Filename, directory, or URL to Kubernetes configuration files can also be provided.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Filename, directory, or URL to kubernetes configuration files that will be used with the commands.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to the specified kubectl command.

inputs.name: secretType
inputs.label: Type of secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create/update a generic or dockerimagepullsecret.

inputs.name: secretArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in secret.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: containerRegistryType
inputs.label: Container Registry type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Container registry type. The task can use Azure Subscription details to work with an Azure Container registry. Other standard Container registries are also supported.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription, which contains Azure Container Registry. Note: To configure new service connection, select the Azure subscription from the list and click 'Authorize'. If your subscription is not listed or if you want to use an existing Service Principal, you can setup an Azure service connection using 'Add' or 'Manage' button.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry which will be used for pulling container images and deploying applications to the Kubernetes cluster. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: secretName
inputs.label: Secret name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the secret. You can use this secret name in the Kubernetes YAML configuration file.

inputs.name: forceUpdate
inputs.label: Force update secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the secret if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: configMapName
inputs.label: ConfigMap name
inputs.helpMarkDown: ConfigMaps allow you to decouple configuration artifacts from image content to keep containerized applications portable.

inputs.name: forceUpdateConfigMap
inputs.label: Force update configmap
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the configmap if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: useConfigMapFile
inputs.label: Use file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create a ConfigMap from an individual file, or from multiple files by specifying a directory.

inputs.name: configMapFile
inputs.label: ConfigMap file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a file or directory that contains the configMaps

inputs.name: configMapArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in configMap.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version Spec of version to get.  Examples: 1.7.0, 1.x.0, 4.x.0, 6.10.0, >=6.10.0

inputs.name: checkLatest
inputs.label: Check for latest version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Always checks online for the latest available version (stable.txt) that satisfies the version spec. This is typically false unless you have a specific scenario to always get latest. This will cause it to incur download costs when potentially not necessary, especially with the hosted build pool.

inputs.name: specifyLocation
inputs.label: Path to Kubectl
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to the kubectl.exe

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for the Kubectl command.

inputs.name: outputFormat
inputs.label: Output format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output format.

inputs.name: kubectlOutput
inputs.label: Output variable name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the variable in which output of the command should be saved.

outputVariables.name: KubectlOutput
outputVariables.description: Stores the output of the kubectl command

inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to the specified kubectl command.

inputs.name: secretType
inputs.label: Type of secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create/update a generic or dockerimagepullsecret.

inputs.name: secretArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in secret.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: containerRegistryType
inputs.label: Container registry type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Container registry type. The task can use Azure Subscription details to work with an Azure Container registry. Other standard Container registries are also supported.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker registry service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpointForSecrets
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription, which contains Azure Container Registry. Note: To configure new service connection, select the Azure subscription from the list and click 'Authorize'. If your subscription is not listed or if you want to use an existing Service Principal, you can setup an Azure service connection using 'Add' or 'Manage' button.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure container registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry which will be used for pulling container images and deploying applications to the Kubernetes cluster. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: secretName
inputs.label: Secret name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the secret. You can use this secret name in the Kubernetes YAML configuration file.

inputs.name: forceUpdate
inputs.label: Force update secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the secret if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: configMapName
inputs.label: ConfigMap name
inputs.helpMarkDown: ConfigMaps allow you to decouple configuration artifacts from image content to keep containerized applications portable.

inputs.name: forceUpdateConfigMap
inputs.label: Force update configmap
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the configmap if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: useConfigMapFile
inputs.label: Use file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create a ConfigMap from an individual file, or from multiple files by specifying a directory.

inputs.name: configMapFile
inputs.label: ConfigMap file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a file or directory that contains the configMaps

inputs.name: configMapArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in configMap.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version Spec of version to get.  Examples: 1.7.0, 1.x.0, 4.x.0, 6.10.0, >=6.10.0

inputs.name: checkLatest
inputs.label: Check for latest version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Always checks online for the latest available version (stable.txt) that satisfies the version spec. This is typically false unless you have a specific scenario to always get latest. This will cause it to incur download costs when potentially not necessary, especially with the hosted build pool.

inputs.name: specifyLocation
inputs.label: Path to kubectl
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to the kubectl.exe

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for the Kubectl command.

inputs.name: outputFormat
inputs.label: Output format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output format.

value.name: NuGetInstaller
value.description: Installs or restores missing NuGet packages
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Path to solution or packages.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the Visual Studio solution file or NuGet packages.config

inputs.name: nugetConfigPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: Equivalent to the -ConfigFile NuGet.exe command line argument

inputs.name: restoreMode
inputs.label: Installation type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Restore will restore the packages a solution depends upon, and is generally what you want.

Install will install packages from a packages.config file. Use this option if you want to install a standalone tool package.

inputs.name: noCache
inputs.label: Disable local cache
inputs.helpMarkDown: Equivalent to the -NoCache NuGet.exe command line argument

inputs.name: nuGetRestoreArgs
inputs.label: NuGet arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to NuGet.exe restore or install. [More Information](https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#user-content-restore-command).

inputs.name: verbosity
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: NuGet's verbosity level

inputs.name: nuGetVersion
inputs.label: NuGet Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of NuGet to use, or external version.

inputs.name: nuGetPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to NuGet.exe. Will override version selection.

value.name: NuGetCommand
value.description: Restore, pack, or push NuGet packages, or run a NuGet command. Supports NuGet.org and authenticated feeds like Package Management and MyGet. Uses NuGet.exe and works with .NET Framework apps. For .NET Core and .NET Standard apps, use the .NET Core task.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet command to run. Select 'Custom' to add arguments or to use a different command.

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Path to solution, packages.config, or project.json
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the solution, packages.config, or project.json file that references the packages to be restored.

inputs.name: selectOrConfig
inputs.label: Feeds to use
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can either select a feed from VSTS and/or NuGet.org here, or commit a nuget.config file to your source code repository and set its path here.

inputs.name: feedRestore
inputs.label: Use packages from this VSTS/TFS feed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include the selected feed in the generated NuGet.config. You must have Package Management installed and licensed to select a feed here.

inputs.name: includeNuGetOrg
inputs.label: Use packages from NuGet.org
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include NuGet.org in the generated NuGet.config.

inputs.name: nugetConfigPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet.config in your repository that specifies the feeds from which to restore packages.

inputs.name: externalEndpoints
inputs.label: Credentials for feeds outside this account/collection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Credentials to use for external registries located in the selected NuGet.config. For feeds in this account/collection, leave this blank; the builds credentials are used automatically.

inputs.name: noCache
inputs.label: Disable local cache
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prevents NuGet from using packages from local machine caches.

inputs.name: disableParallelProcessing
inputs.label: Disable parallel processing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prevents NuGet from installing multiple packages in parallel.

inputs.name: packagesDirectory
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the folder in which packages are installed. If no folder is specified, packages are restored into a packages/ folder alongside the selected solution, packages.config, or project.json.

inputs.name: verbosityRestore
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: searchPatternPush
inputs.label: Path to NuGet package(s) to publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pattern to match or path to nupkg files to be uploaded. Multiple patterns can be separated by a semicolon.

inputs.name: feedPublish
inputs.label: Target feed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a feed hosted in this account. You must have Package Management installed and licensed to select a feed here.

inputs.name: allowPackageConflicts
inputs.label: Allow duplicates to be skipped
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If you continually publish a set of packages and only change the version number of the subset of packages that changed, use this option. It allows the task to report success even if some of your packages are rejected with 409 Conflict errors.

This option is currently only available on Visual Studio Team Services and using Windows agents. If NuGet.exe encounters a conflict, the task will fail.

inputs.name: externalEndpoint
inputs.label: NuGet server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet service connection that contains the external NuGet servers credentials.

inputs.name: verbosityPush
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: searchPatternPack
inputs.label: Path to csproj or nuspec file(s) to pack
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Pattern to search for csproj directories to pack.

You can separate multiple patterns with a semicolon, and you can make a pattern negative by prefixing it with '!'. Example: `**\*.csproj;!**\*.Tests.csproj`

inputs.name: configurationToPack
inputs.label: Configuration to package
inputs.helpMarkDown: When using a csproj file this specifies the configuration to package

inputs.name: outputDir
inputs.label: Package folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where packages will be created. If empty, packages will be created at the source root.

inputs.name: versioningScheme
inputs.label: Automatic package versioning
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Cannot be used with include referenced projects. If you choose 'Use the date and time', this will generate a [SemVer](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)-compliant version formatted as `X.Y.Z-ci-datetime` where you choose X, Y, and Z.

If you choose 'Use an environment variable', you must select an environment variable and ensure it contains the version number you want to use.

If you choose 'Use the build number', this will use the build number to version your package. **Note:** Under Options set the build number format to be '[$(BuildDefinitionName)_$(Year:yyyy).$(Month).$(DayOfMonth)$(Rev:.r)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627416)'.

inputs.name: includeReferencedProjects
inputs.label: Include referenced projects
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include referenced projects either as dependencies or as part of the package. Cannot be used with automatic package versioning. If a referenced project has a corresponding nuspec file that has the same name as the project, then that referenced project is added as a dependency. Otherwise, the referenced project is added as part of the package. [Learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-pack).

inputs.name: versionEnvVar
inputs.label: Environment variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the variable name without $, $env, or %.

inputs.name: requestedMajorVersion
inputs.label: Major
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'X' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: requestedMinorVersion
inputs.label: Minor
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Y' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: requestedPatchVersion
inputs.label: Patch
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Z' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: packTimezone
inputs.label: Time zone
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the desired time zone used to produce the version of the package. Selecting UTC is recommended if you're using hosted build agents as their date and time might differ.

inputs.name: includeSymbols
inputs.label: Create symbols package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies that the package contains sources and symbols. When used with a .nuspec file, this creates a regular NuGet package file and the corresponding symbols package.

inputs.name: toolPackage
inputs.label: Tool Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Determines if the output files of the project should be in the tool folder.

inputs.name: buildProperties
inputs.label: Additional build properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a list of token=value pairs, separated by semicolons, where each occurrence of $token$ in the .nuspec file will be replaced with the given value. Values can be strings in quotation marks.

inputs.name: basePath
inputs.label: Base path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The base path of the files defined in the nuspec file.

inputs.name: verbosityPack
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Command and arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The command and arguments which will be passed to NuGet.exe for execution. If NuGet 3.5 or later is used, authenticated commands like list, restore, and publish against any feed in this account/collection that the Project Collection Build Service has access to will be automatically authenticated.

What's new in Version 1.0:
- Supports the new Azure CLI 2.0 which is Python based
- Works with cross-platform agents (Linux, macOS, or Windows)

- Limitations:
 - No support for Azure Classic subscriptions. Azure CLI 2.0 supports only Azure Resource Manager (ARM) subscriptions.

inputs.defaultValue:
# Write your powershell commands here.

Write-Host "Hello World"

inputs.name: errorActionPreference
