inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepends the line `$ErrorActionPreference = 'VALUE'` at the top of your script.

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely on the exit code to determine failure.

inputs.name: ignoreLASTEXITCODE
inputs.label: Ignore $LASTEXITCODE
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is false, the line `if ((Test-Path -LiteralPath variable:\LASTEXITCODE)) { exit $LASTEXITCODE }` is appended to the end of your script. This will cause the last exit code from an external command to be propagated as the exit code of powershell. Otherwise the line is not appended to the end of your script.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory where the script is run.

value.name: PowerShell
value.description: Run a PowerShell script
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: scriptType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of the script: File Path or Inline Script

inputs.name: scriptName
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script to execute. Should be fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the PowerShell script.  Either ordinal parameters or named parameters

inputs.name: workingFolder
inputs.label: Working folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory when script is run.  Defaults to the folder where the script is located.

inputs.name: inlineScript
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# You can write your powershell scripts inline here. 
# You can also pass predefined and custom variables to this scripts using arguments

 Write-Host "Hello World"

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely solely on $LASTEXITCODE and the exit code to determine failure.

value.name: VSTest
value.description: Run unit and functional tests (Selenium, Appium, Coded UI test, etc.) using the Visual Studio Test runner. Test frameworks that have a Visual Studio test adapter such as xUnit, NUnit, Chutzpah, etc. can also be run. Tests can be distributed on multiple agents using this task (version 2).
value.releaseNotes:
• Run tests using agent phase: Unified agent across Build, Release and Test allows for automation agents to be used for testing purposes as well. You can distribute tests using the multi-agent phase setting. Multi-config phase setting can be used to replicate tests in different configurations. More information
  • Test Impact Analysis: Automatically select and run only the tests needed to validate the code change.
  • Use the Visual Studio Test Platform Installer task to run tests without needing a full Visual Studio installation.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: testSelector
inputs.label: Select tests using
inputs.helpMarkDown:
• Test assembly: Use this option to specify one or more test assemblies that contain your tests. You can optionally specify a filter criteria to select only specific tests.
  • Test plan: Use this option to run tests from your test plan that have an automated test method associated with it.
  • Test run: Use this option when you are setting up an environment to run tests from the Test hub. This option should not be used when running tests in a continuous integration / continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline.

inputs.name: testAssemblyVer2
inputs.label: Test assemblies
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Run tests from the specified files.
Ordered tests and webtests can be run by specifying the .orderedtest and .webtest files respectively. To run .webtest, Visual Studio 2017 Update 4 or higher is needed.

The file paths are relative to the search folder. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns. [More Information](https://aka.ms/minimatchexamples)

inputs.name: testPlan
inputs.label: Test plan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a test plan containing test suites with automated test cases.

inputs.name: testSuite
inputs.label: Test suite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select one or more test suites containing automated test cases. Test case work items must be associated with an automated test method. [Learn more.](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=847773

inputs.name: testConfiguration
inputs.label: Test configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select Test Configuration.

inputs.name: tcmTestRun
inputs.label: Test Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test run based selection is used when triggering automated test runs from the test hub. This option cannot be used for running tests in the CI/CD pipeline.

inputs.name: searchFolder
inputs.label: Search folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder to search for the test assemblies.

inputs.name: testFiltercriteria
inputs.label: Test filter criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional criteria to filter tests from Test assemblies. For example: `Priority=1|Name=MyTestMethod`. [More information](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj155796.aspx)

inputs.name: runOnlyImpactedTests
inputs.label: Run only impacted tests
inputs.helpMarkDown: Automatically select, and run only the tests needed to validate the code change. [More information](https://aka.ms/tialearnmore)

inputs.name: runAllTestsAfterXBuilds
inputs.label: Number of builds after which all tests should be run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of builds after which to automatically run all tests. Test Impact Analysis stores the mapping between test cases and source code. It is recommended to regenerate the mapping by running all tests, on a regular basis.

inputs.name: uiTests
inputs.label: Test mix contains UI tests
inputs.helpMarkDown:
To run UI tests, ensure that the agent is set to run in interactive mode. Setting up an agent to run interactively must be done before queueing the build / release. Checking this box does not configure the agent in interactive mode automatically. This option in the task is to only serve as a reminder to configure agent appropriately to avoid failures.

Hosted Windows agents from the VS 2015 and 2017 pools can be used to run UI tests.
[More information](https://aka.ms/uitestmoreinfo).

inputs.name: vsTestVersion
inputs.label: Test platform version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of Visual Studio test to use. If latest is specified it chooses Visual Studio 2017 or Visual Studio 2015 depending on what is installed. Visual Studio 2013 is not supported. To run tests without needing Visual Studio on the agent, use the Installed by tools installer option. Be sure to include the Visual Studio Test Platform Installer task to acquire the test platform from nuget.

inputs.name: vstestLocation
inputs.label: Path to vstest.console.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to VSTest.

inputs.name: runSettingsFile
inputs.label: Settings file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to runsettings or testsettings file to use with the tests.

inputs.name: overrideTestrunParameters
inputs.label: Override test run parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override parameters defined in the `TestRunParameters` section of runsettings file or `Properties` section of testsettings file. For example: `-key1 value1 -key2 value2`. Note: Properties specified in testsettings file can be accessed via the TestContext using Visual Studio 2017 Update 4 or higher

inputs.name: pathtoCustomTestAdapters
inputs.label: Path to custom test adapters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory path to custom test adapters. Adapters residing in the same folder as the test assemblies are automatically discovered.

inputs.name: runInParallel
inputs.label: Run tests in parallel on multi-core machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set, tests will run in parallel leveraging available cores of the machine. This will override the MaxCpuCount if specified in your runsettings file. [Click here](https://aka.ms/paralleltestexecution) to learn more about how tests are run in parallel.

inputs.name: runTestsInIsolation
inputs.label: Run tests in isolation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Runs the tests in an isolated process. This makes vstest.console.exe process less likely to be stopped on an error in the tests, but tests might run slower. This option currently cannot be used when running with the multi-agent phase setting.

inputs.name: codeCoverageEnabled
inputs.label: Code coverage enabled
inputs.helpMarkDown: Collect code coverage information from the test run.

inputs.name: otherConsoleOptions
inputs.label: Other console options
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Other console options that can be passed to vstest.console.exe, as documented here.

These options are not supported and will be ignored when running tests using the Multi agent parallel setting of an agent phase or when running tests using Test plan option. The options can be specified using a settings file instead.

options.basedOnTestCases: Based on number of tests and agents
options.basedOnExecutionTime: Based on past running time of tests

inputs.name: distributionBatchType
inputs.label: Batch tests
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A batch is a group of tests. A batch of tests runs at a time and results are published for that batch. If the phase in which the task runs is set to use multiple agents, each agent picks up any available batches of tests to run in parallel.

Based on number of tests and agents: Simple batching based on the number of tests and agents participating in the test run.

Based on past running time of tests: This batching considers past running time to create batches of tests such that each batch has approximately equal running time.

Based on test assemblies: Tests from an assembly are batched together.

inputs.name: batchingBasedOnAgentsOption
inputs.label: Batch options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Simple batching based on the number of tests and agents participating in the test run. When the batch size is automatically determined, each batch contains `(total number of tests / number of agents)` tests. If a batch size is specified, each batch will contain the specified number of tests.

inputs.name: customBatchSizeValue
inputs.label: Number of tests per batch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify batch size

inputs.name: batchingBasedOnExecutionTimeOption
inputs.label: Batch options
inputs.helpMarkDown: This batching considers past running time to create batches of tests such that each batch has approximately equal running time. Quick running tests will be batched together, while longer running tests may belong to a separate batch. When this option is used with the multi-agent phase setting, total test time is reduced to a minimum.

inputs.name: customRunTimePerBatchValue
inputs.label: Running time (sec) per batch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the running time (sec) per batch

inputs.name: dontDistribute
inputs.label: Do not distribute tests and replicate instead when multiple agents are used in the phase
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Choosing this option will not distribute tests across agents when the task is running in a multi-agent phase.
Each of the selected test(s) will be repeated on each agent.
The option is not applicable when the agent phase is configured to run with no parallelism or with the multi-config option.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: platform
inputs.label: Build platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build platform against which the tests should be reported. If you have defined a variable for platform in your build task, use that here.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Build configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build configuration against which the tests should be reported. If you have defined a variable for configuration in your build task, use that here.

inputs.name: publishRunAttachments
inputs.label: Upload test attachments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Opt in/out of publishing run level attachments.

inputs.name: rerunFailedTests
inputs.label: Rerun failed tests
inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting this option will rerun any failed tests until they pass or the maximum # of attempts is reached.

inputs.name: rerunType
inputs.label: Do not rerun if test failures exceed specified threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Use this option to avoid rerunning tests when failure rate crosses the specified threshold. This is applicable if any environment issues leads to massive failures.
You can specify % failures or # of failed tests as a threshold.

inputs.name: rerunFailedThreshold
inputs.label: % failure
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to avoid rerunning tests when failure rate crosses the specified threshold. This is applicable if any environment issues leads to massive failures.

inputs.name: rerunFailedTestCasesMaxLimit
inputs.label: # of failed tests
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to avoid rerunning tests when number of failed test cases crosses specified limit. This is applicable if any environment issues leads to massive failures.

inputs.name: rerunMaxAttempts
inputs.label: Maximum # of attempts
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the maximum # of times a failed test should be retried. If a test passes before the maximum # of attempts is reached, it will not be rerun further.

value.name: AzureNLBManagement
value.description: Connect/Disconnect an Azure virtual machine's network interface to a Load Balancer's backend address pool
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the resource group name.

inputs.name: LoadBalancer
inputs.label: Load Balancer Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select or enter the load balancer.

inputs.name: Action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Disconnect:  Removes the virtual machines primary network interface from the load balancers backend pool. So that it stops receiving network traffic.

Connect: Adds the virtual machines primary network interface to load balancer backend pool. So that it starts receiving network traffic based on the load balancing rules for the load balancer resource.

Use the 'Visual Studio Test Platform' task to run tests without needing Visual Studio on the agent. VSTest task also brings new capabilities such as automatically rerunning failed tests.

inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: Mobile Center Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service endpoint for your Visual Studio Mobile Center connection. To create one, click the Manage link and create a new service endpoint.

inputs.name: username

inputs.helpMarkDown: Visit https://mobile.azure.com/settings/profile to get your username.

inputs.name: appSlug

inputs.name: dsymDir

inputs.name: locale
inputs.label: System Language
inputs.helpMarkDown: If your language isn't displayed, select 'Other' and enter its locale below, such as en_US.

inputs.name: userDefinedLocale
inputs.label: Other Locale
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter any two-letter ISO-639 language code along with any two-letter ISO 3166 country code in the format [language]_[country], such as en_US.

inputs.name: loginOpts
inputs.label: Addtional Options for Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to mobile-center login step.

inputs.name: runOpts
inputs.label: Additional Options for Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to mobile-center test run.

inputs.name: async
inputs.label: Do not wait for test result

inputs.name: debug
inputs.label: Enable Debug Output
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add --debug to mobile-center cli.

value.name: AzureWebPowerShellDeployment

value.helpMarkDown: More Information : Azure App Service: Classic Task will be deprecated. We recommend migrating your definition to use Azure App Service Deploy Task instead. For more information please refer [this](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613750).
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription (Classic)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic subscription to target for deployment.

inputs.name: WebSiteLocation
inputs.label: Web App Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a location for website.

inputs.name: WebSiteName
inputs.label: Web App Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter the website name or Select from the list.
Note: Only the websites associated with Default App Service plan for the selected region are listed.

inputs.name: Slot
inputs.label: Slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: Slot

inputs.name: Package
inputs.label: Web Deploy Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the Visual Studio Web Deploy package under the default artifact directory.

inputs.name: doNotDelete
inputs.label: Set DoNotDelete flag
inputs.helpMarkDown: By enabling this, additional files in web deployment package are preserved while publishing website.

value.name: ManualIntervention
value.description: Pause deployment and wait for intervention
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: instructions
inputs.label: Instructions
inputs.helpMarkDown: These instructions will be shown to the user for resuming or rejecting the manual intervention. Based on these instructions the user will take an informed decision about this manual intervention.

inputs.name: emailRecipients
inputs.label: Notify users
inputs.helpMarkDown: Send a manual intervention pending email to specific users (or groups). Only users with manage deployment permission can act on a manual intervention.

inputs.name: onTimeout
inputs.label: On timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Reject or resume this manual intervention automatically after it is pending for the specified timeout or 60 days, whichever is earlier.

value.name: Xcode
value.description: Build an Xcode workspace on Mac OS
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: actions
inputs.label: Actions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Space delimited list of actions.  Valid options are build, clean, test, analyze, and archive.  For example: `build clean` would do a clean build.  See [xcodebuild man page](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/xcodebuild.1.html)

inputs.name: sdk
inputs.label: SDK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build an Xcode project or workspace against the specified SDK.  Run *xcodebuild -showsdks* to see the valid list of SDKs.

inputs.name: xcWorkspacePath
inputs.label: Workspace/Project Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path from repo root to the Xcode workspace or project. For example: `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace` or `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace/MyApp.xcodeproj`. Leave blank if you intend to use the -target flag under Advanced Arguments.

inputs.name: scheme
inputs.label: Scheme
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional scheme name in Xcode. *Must be a shared scheme* (shared checkbox under managed schemes in Xcode). **Required if Workspace is specified.**

inputs.name: packageApp
inputs.label: Create App Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether an IPA should be generated as a part of the build. For exporting archives with Xcode 7 and Xcode 8, review additional inputs in the `Package Options` section.

inputs.name: packageTool
inputs.label: Create Package (IPA) using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the tool to use for generating the IPA.

inputs.name: archivePath
inputs.label: Archive Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify a directory where created archives should be placed.

inputs.name: exportPath
inputs.label: Export Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the destination for the product exported from the archive.

inputs.name: exportOptions
inputs.label: Export Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pick a way to pass in Export Options when exporting the archive.

inputs.name: exportMethod
inputs.label: Export Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Method for how Xcode should export the archive. E.g. app-store, package, ad-hoc, enterprise, development.

inputs.name: exportTeamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 10 digit Team ID from the Apple Developer Portal to use for this export.

inputs.name: exportOptionsPlist
inputs.label: Export Options Plist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a plist file that configures archive exporting.

inputs.name: xcode8AutomaticSigning
inputs.label: Automatic Signing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this if you have an Xcode 8 or Xcode 9 project configured for Automatic Signing.

inputs.name: teamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the 10 digit developer Team ID. This is required if you are a member of multiple development teams.

inputs.name: signMethod
inputs.label: Override Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the build should use a signing or provisioning method that is different than the default, choose that method here. Choose 'File Contents' to use a P12 certificate and provisioning profile. Choose 'Identifiers' to retrieve signing settings from the default Keychain and pre-installed profiles. Leave the corresponding fields blank if you do not wish to override default build settings.

inputs.name: iosSigningIdentity
inputs.label: Signing Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional signing identity override that should be used to sign the build. Defaults to Xcode Project setting. You may need to select Unlock Default Keychain if you use this option.

inputs.name: unlockDefaultKeychain
inputs.label: Unlock Default Keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Resolve "User interaction is not allowed" errors by unlocking the default keychain.

inputs.name: defaultKeychainPassword
inputs.label: Default Keychain Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to unlock the default keychain when this option is set.

inputs.name: provProfileUuid
inputs.label: Provisioning Profile UUID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different Schemes or Targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, WatchKit, tvOS).

inputs.name: p12
inputs.label: P12 Certificate File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to a PKCS12 formatted p12 certificate file containing a signing certificate to be used for this build.

inputs.name: p12pwd
inputs.label: P12 Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to P12 Certificate File if specified. Use a Build Variable to encrypt.

inputs.name: provProfile
inputs.label: Provisioning Profile File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to file containing provisioning profile override to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different Schemes or Targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, WatchKit, tvOS).

inputs.name: removeProfile
inputs.label: Remove Profile After Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies that the contents of the Provisioning Profile File should be removed from the build agent after the build is complete. **Only check if you are running one agent per user.**

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional command line arguments that should be used to build. Useful if you want to use -target or -project instead of specifying a Workspace and Scheme.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for build runs. Defaults to the root of the repository.

inputs.name: outputPattern
inputs.label: Output Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path where build output (binaries) will be placed.

inputs.name: xcodeDeveloperDir
inputs.label: Xcode Developer Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional path to Xcode Developer folder if not the system default. For use when multiple versions of Xcode are installed on a system. Ex: /Applications/Xcode 7.app/Contents/Developer

inputs.name: useXcpretty
inputs.label: Use xcpretty
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use xcpretty to format xcodebuild output and generate JUnit test results report. Requires xcpretty be installed on agent hosts. See [xcpretty](https://github.com/supermarin/xcpretty) for details.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to VSTS/TFS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit Test results produced above using xctool to VSTS/TFS.

inputs.name: useXctool
inputs.label: Use xctool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use xctool instead of xcodebuild. Requires xctool be installed on agent hosts. See [xctool](https://github.com/facebook/xctool) for details. Note: xctool has been deprecated and does not work with Xcode 8.

inputs.name: xctoolReporter
inputs.label: xctool Test Reporter Format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test reporter format to use when "test" action is specified and "Use xctool" is checked. Specify "junit:output-file-path-here.xml" to generate a file format compatible with the Publish Test Results task. When specified, "plain" is automatically added as well. Requires xctool be installed on agent hosts. See [xctool](https://github.com/facebook/xctool) for details. Note: xctool has been deprecated and does not work with Xcode 8.

value.name: Xcode
value.description: Build, test, or archive an Xcode workspace on macOS. Optionally package an app.
value.releaseNotes: This version of the task is compatible with Xcode 8 and Xcode 9. Features that were there solely to maintain compat with Xcode 7 have been removed. The task has better options to work with the Hosted macOS pool.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: actions
inputs.label: Actions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a space-delimited list of actions. Valid options are `build`, `clean`, `test`, `analyze`, and `archive`. For example,`clean build` will run a clean build. See the [xcodebuild man page](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/xcodebuild.1.html).

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Xcode project or workspace configuration to be built. The default value of this field is the variable `$(Configuration)`. When using a variable, make sure to specify a value (for example, `Release`) on the **Variables** tab.

inputs.name: sdk
inputs.label: SDK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify an SDK to use when building the Xcode project or workspace. From the macOS Terminal application, run `xcodebuild -showsdks` to display the valid list of SDKs. The default value of this field is the variable `$(SDK)`. When using a variable, make sure to specify a value (for example, `iphonesimulator`) on the **Variables** tab.

inputs.name: xcWorkspacePath
inputs.label: Workspace or project path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a relative path from the root of the repository to the Xcode workspace or project. For example, `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace` or `MyApp/MyApp.xcodeproj`. Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)).

inputs.name: scheme
inputs.label: Scheme
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a scheme name defined in Xcode. It must be a shared scheme, with its Shared checkbox enabled under Managed Schemes in Xcode. If you specify a Workspace or project path above without specifying a scheme, and the workspace has a single shared scheme, it will be automatically used.

inputs.name: xcodeVersion
inputs.label: Xcode version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the target version of Xcode. Select `Default` to use the default version of Xcode on the agent machine. Selecting a version number (e.g. `Xcode 9`) relies on environment variables being set on the agent machine for the version's location (e.g. `XCODE_9_DEVELOPER_DIR=/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). Select `Specify path` to provide a specific path to the Xcode developer directory.

inputs.name: xcodeDeveloperDir
inputs.label: Xcode developer path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a path to a specific Xcode developer directory (e.g. `/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). This is useful when multiple versions of Xcode are installed on the agent machine.

inputs.name: packageApp
inputs.label: Create app package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicate whether an IPA app package file should be generated as a part of the build.

inputs.name: archivePath
inputs.label: Archive path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify a directory where created archives should be placed.

inputs.name: exportPath
inputs.label: Export path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify the destination for the product exported from the archive.

inputs.name: exportOptions
inputs.label: Export options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a way of providing options for exporting the archive. When the default value of `Automatic` is selected, the export method is automatically detected from the archive. Select `Plist` to specify a plist file containing export options. Select `Specify` to provide a specific **Export method** and **Team ID**.

inputs.name: exportMethod
inputs.label: Export method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the method that Xcode should use to export the archive. For example: `app-store`, `package`, `ad-hoc`, `enterprise`, or `development`.

inputs.name: exportTeamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the 10-character team ID from the Apple Developer Portal to use during export.

inputs.name: exportOptionsPlist
inputs.label: Export options plist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the path to the plist file that contains options to use during export.

inputs.name: exportArgs
inputs.label: Export arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter additional command line arguments to be used during export.

inputs.name: signingOption
inputs.label: Signing style
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the method of signing the build. Select `Do not code sign` to disable signing. Select `Project defaults` to use only the project's signing configuration. Select `Manual signing` to force manual signing and optionally specify a signing identity and provisioning profile. Select `Automatic signing` to force automatic signing and optionally specify a development team ID. If your project requires signing, use the "Install Apple..." tasks to install certificates and provisioning profiles prior to the Xcode build.

inputs.name: signingIdentity
inputs.label: Signing identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a signing identity override with which to sign the build. This may require unlocking the default keychain on the agent machine. If no value is entered, the Xcode project's setting will be used.

inputs.name: provisioningProfileUuid
inputs.label: Provisioning profile UUID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different schemes or targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, tvOS, watchOS).

inputs.name: provisioningProfileName
inputs.label: Provisioning profile name
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the name of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build. If specified, this takes precedence over the provisioning profile UUID. Use separate build tasks with different schemes or targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, tvOS, watchOS).

inputs.name: teamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional, unless you are a member of multiple development teams.) Specify the 10-character development team ID.

inputs.name: destinationPlatformOption
inputs.label: Destination platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the destination device's platform to be used for UI testing when the generic build device isn't valid. Choose `Custom` to specify a platform not included in this list. When `Default` is selected, no simulators nor devices will be targeted.

inputs.name: destinationPlatform
inputs.label: Custom destination platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a destination device's platform to be used for UI testing when the generic build device isn't valid.

inputs.name: destinationTypeOption
inputs.label: Destination type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the destination type to be used for UI testing. Devices must be connected to the Mac performing the build via a cable or network connection. See Devices and Simulators in Xcode.

inputs.name: destinationSimulators
inputs.label: Simulator
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter an Xcode simulator name to be used for UI testing. For example, enter `iPhone X` (iOS and watchOS) or `Apple TV 4K` (tvOS). A target OS version is optional and can be specified in the format 'OS=versionNumber', such as `iPhone X,OS=11.1`. A list of simulators installed on the Hosted macOS agent can be [found here](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=875290).
inputs.visibleRule: destinationPlatformOption != default && destinationPlatformOption != macOS && destinationTypeOption == simulators

inputs.name: destinationDevices
inputs.label: Device
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the name of the device to be used for UI testing, such as `Raisa's iPad`.
inputs.visibleRule: destinationPlatformOption != default && destinationPlatformOption != macOS && destinationTypeOption == devices

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter additional command line arguments with which to build. This is useful for specifying `-target` or `-project` arguments instead of specifying a workspace/project and scheme. See the [xcodebuild man page](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/xcodebuild.1.html).

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the working directory in which to run the build. If no value is entered, the root of the repository will be used.

inputs.name: useXcpretty
inputs.label: Use xcpretty
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to use xcpretty to format xcodebuild output. Enabling this requires xcpretty to be installed on the agent machine. If xcpretty is not installed, raw xcodebuild output is shown. xcpretty is preinstalled on VSTS hosted build agents. See [xcpretty](https://github.com/supermarin/xcpretty) on GitHub.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish test results to VSTS/TFS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to publish JUnit test results to VSTS/TFS. This requires xcpretty to be enabled to generate JUnit test results.

inputs.name: provProfile

inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to file containing provisioning profile override to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different Schemes or Targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, WatchKit, tvOS).

inputs.name: removeProfile
inputs.label: Remove Profile After Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies that the contents of the Provisioning Profile File should be removed from the build agent after the build is complete. **Only check if you are running one agent per user.**

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional command line arguments that should be used to build. Useful if you want to use -target or -project instead of specifying a Workspace and Scheme.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for build runs. Defaults to the root of the repository.

inputs.name: outputPattern
inputs.label: Output Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path where build output (binaries) will be placed.

inputs.name: xcodeDeveloperDir
inputs.label: Xcode Developer Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional path to Xcode Developer folder if not the system default. For use when multiple versions of Xcode are installed on a system. Ex: /Applications/Xcode 7.app/Contents/Developer

inputs.name: useXcpretty
inputs.label: Use xcpretty
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use xcpretty to format xcodebuild output and generate JUnit test results report. Requires xcpretty be installed on agent hosts. See [xcpretty](https://github.com/supermarin/xcpretty) for details.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to VSTS/TFS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit Test results to VSTS/TFS.

value.name: Xcode
value.description: Build, test, or archive an Xcode workspace on macOS. Optionally package an app.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: actions
inputs.label: Actions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a space-delimited list of actions. Valid options are `build`, `clean`, `test`, `analyze`, and `archive`. For example,`clean build` will run a clean build. See the [xcodebuild man page](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/xcodebuild.1.html).

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Xcode project or workspace configuration to be built. The default value of this field is the variable `$(Configuration)`. When using a variable, make sure to specify a value (for example, `Release`) on the **Variables** tab.

inputs.name: sdk
inputs.label: SDK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify an SDK to use when building the Xcode project or workspace. From the macOS Terminal application, run `xcodebuild -showsdks` to display the valid list of SDKs. The default value of this field is the variable `$(SDK)`. When using a variable, make sure to specify a value (for example, `iphonesimulator`) on the **Variables** tab.

inputs.name: xcWorkspacePath
inputs.label: Workspace or project path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a relative path from the root of the repository to the Xcode workspace or project. For example, `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace` or `MyApp/MyApp.xcodeproj`.

inputs.name: scheme
inputs.label: Scheme
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a scheme name defined in Xcode. It must be a shared scheme, with its Shared checkbox enabled under Managed Schemes in Xcode. If you specify a Workspace or project path above without specifying a scheme, and the workspace has a single shared scheme, it will be automatically used.

inputs.name: xcodeVersion
inputs.label: Xcode version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the target version of Xcode. Select `Default` to use the default version of Xcode on the agent machine. Selecting a version number (e.g. `Xcode 9`) relies on environment variables being set on the agent machine for the version's location (e.g. `XCODE_9_DEVELOPER_DIR=/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). Select `Specify path` to provide a specific path to the Xcode developer directory.

inputs.name: xcodeDeveloperDir
inputs.label: Xcode developer path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a path to a specific Xcode developer directory (e.g. `/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). This is useful when multiple versions of Xcode are installed on the agent machine.

inputs.name: packageApp
inputs.label: Create app package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicate whether an IPA app package file should be generated as a part of the build.

inputs.name: archivePath
inputs.label: Archive path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify a directory where created archives should be placed.

inputs.name: exportPath
inputs.label: Export path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify the destination for the product exported from the archive.

inputs.name: exportOptions
inputs.label: Export options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a way of providing options for exporting the archive. When the default value of `Automatic` is selected, the export method is automatically detected from the archive. Select `Plist` to specify a plist file containing export options. Select `Specify` to provide a specific **Export method** and **Team ID**.

inputs.name: exportMethod
inputs.label: Export method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the method that Xcode should use to export the archive. For example: `app-store`, `package`, `ad-hoc`, `enterprise`, or `development`.

inputs.name: exportTeamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the 10-character team ID from the Apple Developer Portal to use during export.

inputs.name: exportOptionsPlist
inputs.label: Export options plist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the path to the plist file that contains options to use during export.

inputs.name: exportArgs
inputs.label: Export arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter additional command line arguments to be used during export.

inputs.name: signingOption
inputs.label: Signing style
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the method of signing the build. Select `Do not code sign` to disable signing. Select `Project defaults` to use only the project's signing configuration. Select `Manual signing` to force manual signing and optionally specify a signing identity and provisioning profile. Select `Automatic signing` to force automatic signing and optionally specify a development team ID. If your project requires signing, use the "Install Apple..." tasks to install certificates and provisioning profiles prior to the Xcode build.

inputs.name: signingIdentity
inputs.label: Signing identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a signing identity override with which to sign the build. This may require unlocking the default keychain on the agent machine. If no value is entered, the Xcode project's setting will be used.

inputs.name: provisioningProfileUuid
inputs.label: Provisioning profile UUID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different schemes or targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, tvOS, watchOS).

inputs.name: teamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional, unless you are a member of multiple development teams.) Specify the 10-character development team ID.

inputs.name: destinationPlatformOption
inputs.label: Destination platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the destination device's platform to be used for UI testing when the generic build device isn't valid. Choose `Custom` to specify a platform not included in this list. When `Default` is selected, no simulators nor devices will be targeted.

inputs.name: destinationPlatform
inputs.label: Custom destination platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a destination device's platform to be used for UI testing when the generic build device isn't valid.

inputs.name: destinationTypeOption
inputs.label: Destination type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the destination type to be used for UI testing. Devices must be connected to the Mac performing the build via a cable or network connection. See Devices and Simulators in Xcode.

inputs.name: destinationSimulators
inputs.label: Simulator
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter an Xcode simulator name to be used for UI testing. For example, enter `iPhone X` (iOS and watchOS) or `Apple TV 4K` (tvOS). A target OS version is optional and can be specified in the format 'OS=versionNumber', such as `iPhone X,OS=11.1`. A list of simulators installed on the Hosted macOS Preview agent can be [found here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mobile-center/build/software).
inputs.visibleRule: destinationPlatformOption != default && destinationPlatformOption != macOS && destinationTypeOption == simulators

inputs.name: destinationDevices
inputs.label: Device
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the name of the device to be used for UI testing, such as `Raisa's iPad`.
inputs.visibleRule: destinationPlatformOption != default && destinationPlatformOption != macOS && destinationTypeOption == devices

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter additional command line arguments with which to build. This is useful for specifying `-target` or `-project` arguments instead of specifying a workspace/project and scheme. See the [xcodebuild man page](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/xcodebuild.1.html).

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the working directory in which to run the build. If no value is entered, the root of the repository will be used.

inputs.name: outputPattern
inputs.label: Output directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a path relative to the working directory where build output (binaries) will be placed. Examples: `output/$(SDK)/$(Configuration)` or `output/$(TestSDK)/$(TestConfiguration)`. Archive and export paths are configured separately.

inputs.name: useXcpretty
inputs.label: Use xcpretty
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to use xcpretty to format xcodebuild output and generate JUnit test results. Enabling this requires xcpretty to be installed on the agent machine. It is preinstalled on VSTS hosted build agents. See [xcpretty](https://github.com/supermarin/xcpretty) on GitHub.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish test results to VSTS/TFS
inputs.helpMarkDown: If xcpretty is enabled above, specify whether to publish JUnit test results to VSTS/TFS.

value.name: Gulp
value.description: Node.js streaming task based build system
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: gulpFile
inputs.label: Gulp File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the gulp file script file to run.

inputs.name: targets
inputs.label: Gulp Task(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional.  Space delimited list of tasks to run.  If not specified, the default task will run.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to gulp.  --gulpfile is not needed since already added via gulpFile input above.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory when script is run.  Defaults to the folder where the script is located.

inputs.name: gulpjs
inputs.label: gulp.js location
inputs.helpMarkDown: gulp.js to run when agent can't find global installed gulp.  Defaults to the gulp.js under node_modules folder of the working directory.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to TFS/Team Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Gulp build to TFS/Team Services.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test Results Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test Run Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: enableCodeCoverage
inputs.label: Enable code Coverage
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to enable Code Coverage using Istanbul.

inputs.name: testFramework
inputs.label: Test Framework
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select your test framework.

inputs.name: srcFiles
inputs.label: Source Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the path to your source files which you want to hookRequire()

inputs.name: testFiles
inputs.label: Test Script Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the path to your test script files

value.name: XamarinAndroid
value.description: Build an Android app with Xamarin
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of Xamarin.Android project(s) to build.  Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)).  For example, `**/*.csproj` for all csproj files in all subfolders.  The project must have a PackageForAndroid target if `Create App Package` is selected.

inputs.name: target
inputs.label: Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build these targets in this project. Use a semicolon to separate multiple targets.

inputs.name: outputDir
inputs.label: Output directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally provide the output directory for the build. Example: $(build.binariesDirectory)/bin/Release.

inputs.name: createAppPackage
inputs.label: Create app package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Passes the target (/t:PackageForAndroid) during build to generate an APK.

inputs.name: clean
inputs.label: Clean
inputs.helpMarkDown: Passes the clean target (/t:clean) during build.

inputs.name: msbuildVersion
inputs.label: MSBuild version
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the preferred version cannot be found, the latest version found will be used instead. On macOS, xbuild (Mono) or MSBuild (Visual Studio for Mac) will be used.

inputs.name: msbuildLocation
inputs.label: MSBuild location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to MSBuild (on Windows) or xbuild (on macOS).

inputs.name: msbuildArchitecture
inputs.label: MSBuild architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of MSBuild to run.

inputs.name: msbuildArguments
inputs.label: Additional arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to MSBuild (on Windows) or xbuild (on macOS).

inputs.name: jdkSelection
inputs.label: Select JDK to use for the build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pick the JDK to be used during the build by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the selected JDK version during build.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the JDK version at specified path during build.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of JDK.

value.name: ServiceFabricUpdateAppVersions
value.description: Automatically updates the versions of a packaged Service Fabric application.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: applicationPackagePath
inputs.label: Application Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the application package. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path.

inputs.name: versionSuffix
inputs.label: Version Value
inputs.helpMarkDown: The value used to specify the version in the manifest files. Default is .$(Build.BuildNumber).

inputs.name: versionBehavior
inputs.label: Version Behavior
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to append the version value to existing values in the manifest files or replace them.

inputs.name: updateOnlyChanged
inputs.label: Update only if changed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Incrementally update only the packages that have changed. Use the [deterministic compiler flag](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=808668) to ensure builds with the same inputs produce the same outputs.

inputs.name: pkgArtifactName
inputs.label: Package Artifact Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the artifact containing the application package for comparison.

inputs.name: logAllChanges
inputs.label: Log all changes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Compare all files in every package and log if the file was added, removed, or if its content changed. Otherwise, compare files in a package only until the first change is found for faster performance.

inputs.name: compareType
inputs.label: Compare against
inputs.helpMarkDown: The build for comparison.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build Number
inputs.helpMarkDown: The build number for comparison.

value.name: ServiceFabricUpdateManifests
value.description: Automatically updates portions of the application and service manifests within a packaged Service Fabric application.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: updateType
inputs.label: Update Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the type of update that should be made to the manifest files. In order to use both update types, add an instance of this task to the build pipeline for each type of update to be executed.

inputs.name: applicationPackagePath
inputs.label: Application Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the application package. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path.

inputs.name: versionSuffix
inputs.label: Version Value
inputs.helpMarkDown: The value used to specify the version in the manifest files. Default is .$(Build.BuildNumber).

inputs.name: versionBehavior
inputs.label: Version Behavior
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to append the version value to existing values in the manifest files or replace them.

inputs.name: updateOnlyChanged
inputs.label: Update only if changed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Incrementally update only the packages that have changed. Use the [deterministic compiler flag](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=808668) to ensure builds with the same inputs produce the same outputs.

inputs.name: pkgArtifactName
inputs.label: Package Artifact Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the artifact containing the application package for comparison.

inputs.name: logAllChanges
inputs.label: Log all changes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Compare all files in every package and log if the file was added, removed, or if its content changed. Otherwise, compare files in a package only until the first change is found for faster performance.

inputs.name: compareType
inputs.label: Compare against
inputs.helpMarkDown: The build for comparison.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build Number
inputs.helpMarkDown: The build number for comparison.

inputs.name: overwriteExistingPkgArtifact
inputs.label: Overwrite Existing Package Artifact
inputs.helpMarkDown: Always download a new copy of the artifact. Otherwise use an existing copy, if present.

inputs.name: imageDigestsPath
inputs.label: Image Digests Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a text file that contains the digest values of the Docker images associated with the Service Fabric application. This file can be output by the [Docker task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=848006) when using the push action. The file should contain lines of text in the format of 'registry/image_name@digest_value'.

value.name: XcodePackageiOS
value.description: Generate an .ipa file from Xcode build output using xcrun (Xcode 7 or below)
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Name of .app
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the .app, which is sometimes different from the .ipa

inputs.name: ipaName
inputs.label: Name of .ipa
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the .ipa, which is sometimes different from the .app

inputs.name: provisioningProfile
inputs.label: Provisioning Profile Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the provisioning profile to use when signing.

inputs.name: sdk
inputs.label: SDK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the specified SDK.  Run **xcodebuild -showsdks** to see the valid list of SDKs.

inputs.name: appPath
inputs.label: Path to .app
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path to the built .app file

inputs.name: ipaPath
inputs.label: Path to place .ipa
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path where the .ipa will be placed. The directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

value.name: DeployVisualStudioTestAgent
value.description: Deploy and configure Test Agent to run tests on a set of machines
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: testMachineGroup
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol. Eg: `dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986` Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: `$(variableName)` Or provide a Machine Group Name.` If you are using HTTPS, name/IP of machine should match the CN in the certificate.

inputs.name: adminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: adminPassword
inputs.label: Admin Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as `$(passwordVariable)`.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: winRmProtocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). Default is `HTTPS`.

inputs.name: testCertificate
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate by a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: testMachines
inputs.label: Filter Criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a list of machines like `dbserver.fabrikam.com, dbserver_int.fabrikam.com, 192.168.12.34 or tags like Role:DB;OS:Win8.1`. Returns machines with either of the tags. For Azure Resource Group provide the VM Host Name for the machine name. The default is to deploy agent on all machines represented in the Machines field.

inputs.name: machineUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username with which test agent needs to run.

inputs.name: machinePassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the username given above.

inputs.name: runAsProcess
inputs.label: Interactive Process
inputs.helpMarkDown: Denotes if test agent needs to run as an interactive process, needed for Coded UI Tests.

inputs.name: agentLocation
inputs.label: Test Agent Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to vstf_testagent.exe from network or local location. If no path is provided, it will be downloaded from `https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=827840`

inputs.name: updateTestAgent
inputs.label: Update Test Agent
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify if test agent needs to be updated.

inputs.name: isDataCollectionOnly
inputs.label: Enable Data Collection Only
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify if test agent needs to be used only for datacollection and not for running tests. Typically done on application under test(AUT) machine group.

value.name: DeployVisualStudioTestAgent
value.description: Deprecated: This task and its companion task (Run Functional Tests) are deprecated. Use the 'Visual Studio Test' task instead. The VSTest task can run unit as well as functional tests. Run tests on one or more agents using the multi-agent phase setting. Use the 'Visual Studio Test Platform' task to run tests without needing Visual Studio on the agent. VSTest task also brings new capabilities such as automatically rerunning failed tests.
value.releaseNotes:
• Support for Visual Studio Test Agent 2017: You can now deploy and run tests using multiple versions of Visual Studio Test Agent. Versions 2015 and 2017 are supported.
  • Machine groups created from the Test hub are no longer supported. You can continue to use a list of machines or Azure resource groups.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: testMachines
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol. Eg: `dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986` Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: `$(variableName)`. If you are using HTTPS, name/IP of machine should match the CN in the certificate.

inputs.name: adminUserName
inputs.label: Admin login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: adminPassword
inputs.label: Admin password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as `$(passwordVariable)`.
You may mark a variable as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: winRmProtocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the protocol to use for the WinRM service connection with the machine(s). Default is `HTTP`.

inputs.name: testCertificate
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate by a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: machineUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username with which test agent needs to run.

inputs.name: machinePassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the username given above.

inputs.name: runAsProcess
inputs.label: Run UI tests
inputs.helpMarkDown: Denotes if test agent needs to run as an interactive process, needed for Coded UI Tests.

inputs.name: isDataCollectionOnly
inputs.label: Enable data collection only
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify if test agent needs to be used only for data collection and not for running tests. Typically done on application under test(AUT) machine group.

inputs.name: testPlatform
inputs.label: Test agent version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of Visual Studio test agent to use. Pick an appropriate version to match the VS version using which test binaries were built.

inputs.name: agentLocation
inputs.label: Test agent location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to vstf_testagent.exe from network or local location. If no path is provided, it will be automatically downloaded from the Download Center. Installer for Test Agent 2015 Update 3 from `https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=827840`. Installer for Test Agent 2017 from `https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vs_TestAgent.exe`. Refer to `https://aka.ms/testagentlocation` for details on how to use offline installers.

inputs.name: updateTestAgent
inputs.label: Update test agent
inputs.helpMarkDown: If Test Agent is already deployed on a machine, this option checks to see if an update is available for that version of the Test Agent.

value.name: PublishCodeCoverageResults
value.description: Publish Cobertura or JaCoCo code coverage results from a build
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: codeCoverageTool
inputs.label: Code coverage tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: The tool with which code coverage results are generated.

inputs.name: summaryFileLocation
inputs.label: Summary file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the summary file containing code coverage statistics, such as line, method, and class coverage. The value may contain minimatch patterns. For example: `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/MyApp/**/site/cobertura/coverage.xml`

inputs.name: reportDirectory
inputs.label: Report directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the code coverage HTML report directory. The report directory is published for later viewing as an artifact of the build. The value may contain minimatch patterns. For example: `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/MyApp/**/site/cobertura`

inputs.name: additionalCodeCoverageFiles
inputs.label: Additional files
inputs.helpMarkDown: File path pattern specifying any additional code coverage files to be published as artifacts of the build. The value may contain minimatch patterns. For example: `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/**/*.exec`

inputs.name: failIfCoverageEmpty
inputs.label: Fail when code coverage results are missing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the task if code coverage did not produce any results to publish.

value.name: JenkinsQueueJob
value.description: Queue a job on a Jenkins server
value.helpMarkDown: This step queues a job on a [Jenkins](https://jenkins.io/) server. Full integration capabilities require installation of the [Team Foundation Server Plugin](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Team+Foundation+Server+Plugin) on Jenkins. [More Information](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=816956).
value.author: Microsoft

inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: Jenkins service endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service endpoint for your Jenkins instance.  To create one, click the Manage link and create a new Jenkins service endpoint.

inputs.name: jobName
inputs.label: Job name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Jenkins job to queue.  This must exactly match the job name on the Jenkins server.

inputs.name: isMultibranchJob
inputs.label: Job is of Multibranch Pipeline type
inputs.helpMarkDown: This job is of Multibranch Pipeline type.  If selected, enter the appropriate branch name. Requires Team Foundation Server Plugin for Jenkins v5.3.4 or later.

inputs.name: multibranchPipelineBranch
inputs.label: Multibranch Pipeline Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Queue this Multibranch Pipeline job on the specified branch. Requires Team Foundation Server Plugin for Jenkins v5.3.4 or later.

inputs.name: captureConsole
inputs.label: Capture console output and wait for completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, this step will capture the Jenkins build console output, wait for the Jenkins build to complete, and succeed/fail based on the Jenkins build result.  Otherwise, once the Jenkins job is successfully queued, this step will successfully complete without waiting for the Jenkins build to run.

inputs.name: capturePipeline
inputs.label: Capture pipeline output and wait for pipeline completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, this step will capture the full Jenkins build pipeline console output, wait for the full Jenkins build pipeline to complete, and succeed/fail based on the Jenkins build pipeline result.  Otherwise, once the first Jenkins job completes, this step will successfully complete without waiting for full Jenkins build pipeline to run.

inputs.name: parameterizedJob
inputs.label: Parameterized job
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if the Jenkins job accepts parameters. This should be selected even if all default parameter values are used and no parameters are actually specified.

inputs.name: jobParameters
inputs.label: Job parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify job parameters, one per line, in the form `=`

To set a parameter to an empty value (useful for overriding a default value), leave off the parameter value. For example, specify `=`

Variables are supported. For example, to set a `commitId` parameter value to the Git commit ID of the build, use: `commitId=$(Build.SourceVersion)`. See the [documentation on variables](https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/build/define/variables) for more details.

Supported Jenkins parameter types are:

  • `Boolean`
  • `Choice`
  • `Password`
  • `String`

outputVariables.name: JENKINS_JOB_ID
outputVariables.description: The ID of the Jenkins job instance queued by this task. Use this variable in the Jenkins Download Artifacts task to download the artifacts for this particular job instance.

value.name: JenkinsQueueJob
value.description: Queue a job on a Jenkins server
value.helpMarkDown: This task queues a job on a [Jenkins](https://jenkins.io/) server. Full integration capabilities require installation of the [Team Foundation Server Plugin](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Team+Foundation+Server+Plugin) on Jenkins. [More Information](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=816956).

inputs.name: serverEndpoint

inputs.name: jobName

inputs.name: isMultibranchJob
inputs.label: Job is of multibranch pipeline type
inputs.helpMarkDown: This job is of multibranch pipeline type.  If selected, enter the appropriate branch name. Requires Team Foundation Server Plugin for Jenkins v5.3.4 or later.

inputs.name: multibranchPipelineBranch

inputs.helpMarkDown: Queue this multibranch pipeline job on the specified branch. This requires Team Foundation Server Plugin for Jenkins v5.3.4 or later.

inputs.name: captureConsole
inputs.label: Capture console output and wait for completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, this task will capture the Jenkins build console output, wait for the Jenkins build to complete, and succeed/fail based on the Jenkins build result.  Otherwise, once the Jenkins job is successfully queued, this task will successfully complete without waiting for the Jenkins build to run.

inputs.name: capturePipeline
inputs.label: Capture pipeline output and wait for pipeline completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, this task will capture the full Jenkins build pipeline console output, wait for the full Jenkins build pipeline to complete, and succeed/fail based on the Jenkins build pipeline result.  Otherwise, once the first Jenkins job completes, this task will successfully complete without waiting for full Jenkins build pipeline to run.

inputs.name: parameterizedJob
inputs.label: Parameterized job
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if the Jenkins job accepts parameters. This should be selected even if all default parameter values are used and no parameters are actually specified.

inputs.name: jobParameters
inputs.label: Job parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify job parameters, one per line, in the form `=`

To set a parameter to an empty value (useful for overriding a default value), leave off the parameter value. For example, specify `=`

Variables are supported. For example, to set a `commitId` parameter value to the Git commit ID of the build, use: `commitId=$(Build.SourceVersion)`. See the [documentation on variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=875288) for more details.

Supported Jenkins parameter types are:

  • `Boolean`
  • `Choice`
  • `Password`
  • `String`

inputs.name: containerregistrytype
inputs.label: Container Registry Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Container Registry Type.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the Docker file to use. Must be within the Docker build context.

inputs.label: Build Arguments

inputs.name: context

inputs.label: Image Name

inputs.visibleRule: action == Build an image || action == Push an image || action == Run an image

inputs.name: imageNamesPath
inputs.label: Image Names Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a text file that contains the names of the Docker images to tag or push. Each image name is contained on its own line.
inputs.visibleRule: action == Tag images || action == Push images

inputs.name: qualifyImageName
inputs.label: Qualify Image Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Qualify the image name with the Docker registry service connection's hostname if not otherwise specified.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build an image || action = Tag images || action = Push an image || action = Push images || action = Run an image

inputs.label: Additional Image Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional tags for the Docker image being built or pushed.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build an image || action = Tag images || action = Push an image || action = Push images

inputs.name: includeSourceTags
inputs.label: Include Source Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include Git tags when building or pushing the Docker image.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build an image || action = Tag image || action = Push an image || action = Push images

inputs.name: includeLatestTag

inputs.helpMarkDown: Include the 'latest' tag when building or pushing the Docker image.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build an image || action = Push an image || action = Push images

inputs.name: imageDigestFile
inputs.label: Image Digest File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a file that is created and populated with the full image repository digest of the Docker image that was pushed.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Push an image || action = Push images

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Docker container to run.

inputs.name: ports
inputs.label: Ports

inputs.name: volumes
inputs.label: Volumes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Volumes to mount from the host. Specify each host-dir:container-dir on a new line.

inputs.name: envVars
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Environment variables for the Docker container. Specify each name=value pair on a new line.

inputs.name: workDir
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory for the Docker container.

inputs.name: entrypoint
inputs.label: Entry Point Override
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override the default entry point for the Docker container.

inputs.name: containerCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Command to run in the Docker container. For example, if the image contains a simple Python Flask web application you can specify 'python app.py' to launch the web application.

inputs.name: detached
inputs.label: Run In Background
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the Docker container in the background.

inputs.name: restartPolicy
inputs.label: Restart Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a restart policy.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Run an image && detached = true

inputs.name: restartMaxRetries
inputs.label: Maximum Restart Retries
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum number of restart retries the Docker daemon attempts.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Run an image && detached = true && restartPolicy = onFailure

inputs.name: customCommand

inputs.helpMarkDown: Docker command to execute, with arguments. For example, 'rmi -f image-name' to force remove an image.

inputs.name: dockerHostEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Host Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker host service connection. Defaults to the agent's host.

inputs.name: enforceDockerNamingConvention
inputs.label: Force image name to follow Docker naming convention
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled docker image name will be modified to follow Docker naming convention. Converts upper case character to lower case and removes spaces in image name.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for the Docker command.

inputs.name: memory
inputs.label: Memory limit
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum amount of memory available to the container as a integer with optional suffixes like '2GB'.

inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: File share path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file share to which the artifact files will be copied. This can include variables. Example: \\\\my\\share\\$(Build.DefinitionName)\\$(Build.BuildNumber). Publishing artifacts from a Linux or macOS agent to a file share is not supported.

inputs.name: Parallel
inputs.label: Parallel copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select whether to copy files in parallel using multiple threads for greater potential throughput. If this setting is not enabled, one thread will be used.

inputs.name: ParallelCount
inputs.label: Parallel count
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the degree of parallelism, or number of threads used, to perform the copy. The value must be at least 1 and not greater than 128.
