inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The UNC file path location to copy the artifact. It must be accessible from the build agent.

value.name: DownloadBuildArtifacts
value.description: Download Build Artifacts
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: buildType
inputs.label: Download artifacts produced by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by the current build, or from a specific build.

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: The project from which to download the build artifacts

inputs.name: definition
inputs.label: Build pipeline
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the build pipeline name

inputs.name: specificBuildWithTriggering
inputs.label: When appropriate, download artifacts from the triggering build.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, this build task will try to download artifacts from the triggering build. If there is no triggering build from the specified pipeline, it will download artifacts from the build specified in the options below.

inputs.name: branchName
inputs.label: Branch name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify to filter on branch/ref name, for example: ```refs/heads/develop```.

inputs.name: buildId
inputs.label: Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: The build from which to download the artifacts

inputs.name: downloadType
inputs.label: Download type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download a specific artifact or specific files from the build.

inputs.name: artifactName
inputs.label: Artifact name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the artifact to download

inputs.name: itemPattern
inputs.label: Matching pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify files to be downloaded as multi line minimatch pattern. [More Information](https://aka.ms/minimatchexamples)

The default pattern (\*\*) will download all files across all artifacts in the build if "Specific files" option is selected. To download all files within artifact drop use drop/**.

inputs.name: downloadPath
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path on the agent machine where the artifacts will be downloaded

inputs.name: parallelizationLimit
inputs.label: Parallelization limit
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of files to download simultaneously

value.name: MSBuild
value.description: Build with MSBuild
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the project(s) or solution(s) to run.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**/*.csproj` for all csproj files in all sub folders.

inputs.name: msbuildVersion
inputs.label: MSBuild Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the preferred version cannot be found, the latest version found will be used instead. On an macOS agent, xbuild (Mono) will be used if version is lower than 15.0.

inputs.name: msbuildArchitecture
inputs.label: MSBuild Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of MSBuild to run.

inputs.name: msbuildLocation
inputs.label: Path to MSBuild
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to MSBuild.

inputs.name: msbuildArguments
inputs.label: MSBuild Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to MSBuild (on Windows) and xbuild (on macOS).

inputs.name: clean
inputs.label: Clean
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run a clean build (/t:clean) prior to the build.

inputs.name: maximumCpuCount
inputs.label: Build in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: If your MSBuild target configuration is compatible with building in parallel, you can optionally check this input to pass the /m switch to MSBuild (Windows only). If your target configuration is not compatible with building in parallel, checking this option may cause your build to result in file-in-use errors, or intermittent or inconsistent build failures.

inputs.name: restoreNugetPackages
inputs.label: Restore NuGet Packages
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option is deprecated. To restore NuGet packages, add a NuGet Installer step before the build.

inputs.name: logProjectEvents
inputs.label: Record Project Details
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally record timeline details for each project (Windows only).

inputs.name: createLogFile
inputs.label: Create Log File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally create a log file (Windows only).

value.name: NuGet
value.description: Deprecated: use the NuGet task instead. It works with the new Tool Installer framework so you can easily use new versions of NuGet without waiting for a task update, provides better support for authenticated feeds outside this account/collection, and uses NuGet 4 by default.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The NuGet command to run.

Examples: restore, pack

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments for the provided command

value.name: SqlServerDacpacDeployment
value.description: Deploy SQL Server Database using DACPAC
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: Protocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). Default is HTTPS.

inputs.name: TestCertificate
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate by a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: DacpacFile
inputs.label: DACPAC File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the DACPAC file on the target machines or on a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.dacpac. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported like $env:windir, $env:systemroot, like, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\Web.

inputs.name: TargetMethod
inputs.label: Specify SQL Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to connect to the target SQL Server Database. The options are to provide SQL Server Database details, or a SQL Server connection string, or a Publish profile XML file.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SQL Server name like, machinename\FabriakmSQL,1433 or localhost or .\SQL2012R2. Specifying localhost will connect to the Default SQL Server instance on the machine.

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the SQL Server database.

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: SQL Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the SQL Server login is specified, it will be used to connect to the SQL Server. The default is Integrated Authentication and uses the machine administrator's credentials.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: SQL Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: If SQL Server login user name is specified, then provide the SQL Server password. The default is Integrated Authentication and uses the machine administrator's credentials.

inputs.name: ConnectionString
inputs.label: Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the SQL Server connection string like "Server=localhost;Database=Fabrikam;User ID=sqluser;Password=password;".

inputs.name: PublishProfile
inputs.label: Publish Profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish profile provide fine-grained control over SQL Server database creation or upgrades. Specify the path to the Publish profile XML file on the target machine or on a UNC share that is accessible by the machine administrator's credentials.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional SqlPackage.exe arguments that will be applied when creating or updating the SQL Server database like, /p:IgnoreAnsiNulls=True /p:IgnoreComments=True. These arguments will override the settings in the Publish profile XML file (if provided).

inputs.name: DeployInParallel
inputs.label: Deploy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will run the database deployment task in-parallel on the target machines.

inputs.name: ResourceFilteringMethod
inputs.label: Select Machines By
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally, select a subset of machines either by providing machine names or tags.

inputs.name: MachineFilter
inputs.label: Deploy to Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: This input is valid only for machine groups and is not supported for flat list of machines or output variables yet. Provide a list of machines like, dbserver.fabrikam.com, webserver.fabrikam.com, 192.168.12.34, or tags like, Role:DB; OS:Win8.1. If multiple tags are provided, then the task will run in all the machines with the specified tags. For Azure Resource Groups, provide the virtual machine's name like, ffweb, ffdb. The default is to run the task in all machines.

value.name: PowerShellOnTargetMachines
value.description: Execute PowerShell scripts on remote machine(s). This version of the task uses PSSession and Invoke-Command for remoting.
value.releaseNotes:
Use PSSession and invoke-command to perform remoting on target machines.

* Added support for inline script execution.

* Default and Credssp authentication are supported.

* Added options for error handling: ErrorActionPreference, ignoreLASTEXITCODE and Fail on Standard Error.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: Machines
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986
Or provide build or release variables. Eg: $(variableName)
If you are using HTTPS, name/IP of machine should match the CN in the certificate.

inputs.name: UserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Username for the target machines. The user should be a part of Administrators group or WinRM remote management users group.
Eg: Format: Domain\Admin User, Admin User@Domain, .\Admin User

inputs.name: UserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: ScriptType
inputs.label: Script Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The type of script to execute: Inline or File Path

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: Script File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the PowerShell script on the target machines or on a UNC path like C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\Website.ps1 which should be accessible from the target machine.

inputs.name: InlineScript
inputs.label: Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# Write your powershell commands here.

Write-Output "Hello World"

inputs.name: ScriptArguments
inputs.label: Script Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments for the PowerShell script. Can be ordinal parameters or named parameters like -testParam test

inputs.name: InitializationScript
inputs.label: Initialization script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the data script for DSC on the target machines or on a UNC path like C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\WebsiteConfiguration.ps1

inputs.name: SessionVariables
inputs.label: Session Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set common session variables for both the scripts. Variable assignments should be valid PowerShell statements.

inputs.name: CommunicationProtocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the protocol to use for the WinRM service connection with the machine(s). Default is HTTPS.

inputs.name: AuthenticationMechanism
inputs.label: Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mechanism to be used for creating the pssession. For 'CredSSP' authentication, username and password fields are mandatory.

inputs.name: NewPsSessionOptionArguments
inputs.label: Session Option parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Advanced options for remote session (New-PSSessionOption). For example, -SkipCACheck, -SkipCNCheck, -SkipRevocationCheck etc. For a complete list of all session options, see [this](https://aka.ms/Vsts_PS_TM_v3_NewPSSessionOptions)

inputs.name: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.label: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepends the line `$ErrorActionPreference = 'VALUE'` at the top of your script.

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely on the exit code to determine failure.

inputs.name: ignoreLASTEXITCODE
inputs.label: Ignore $LASTEXITCODE
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is false, the line `if ((Test-Path -LiteralPath variable:\LASTEXITCODE)) { exit $LASTEXITCODE }` is executed at the end of your script. This will cause the last exit code from an external command to be propagated as the exit code of powershell. Otherwise the line is not executed to the end of your script.

inputs.name: WorkingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory where the script is run.

inputs.name: RunPowershellInParallel
inputs.label: Run PowerShell in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will run the PowerShell scripts in parallel on the target machines.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: WebAppKind
inputs.label: App type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select type of web app to deploy.
Note: Select Linux Web App for built-in platform images or custom container image deployments.

inputs.name: WebAppName
inputs.label: App Service name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select the name of an existing Azure App Service. App services based on selected app type will only be listed.

inputs.name: DeployToSlotFlag
inputs.label: Deploy to slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to deploy to an existing slot other than the Production slot. If this option is not selected, then the Azure App Service will be deployed to the Production slot.

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select the Azure Resource group that contains the Azure App Service specified above.

inputs.name: SlotName
inputs.label: Slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select an existing Slot other than the Production slot.

inputs.name: ImageSource
inputs.label: Image Source
inputs.helpMarkDown:
App Service on Linux offers two different options to publish your application
Custom image deployment or App deployment with a built-in platform image. [Learn More](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=862490)

inputs.name: AzureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A globally unique top-level domain name for your specific registry.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: AzureContainerRegistryLoginServer
inputs.label: Registry Login Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select an Azure container registry login server name.

inputs.name: AzureContainerRegistryImage
inputs.label: Image
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of the repository where the container images are stored.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: AzureContainerRegistryTag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Tags are optional, it is the mechanism that registries use to give Docker images a version.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: DockerRepositoryAccess
inputs.label: Repository Access
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Docker repository access.

inputs.name: RegistryConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Registry Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the registry connection.

inputs.name: PrivateRegistryImage
inputs.label: Image
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of the repository where the container images are stored.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: PrivateRegistryTag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Tags are optional, it is the mechanism that registries use to give Docker images a version.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: DockerNamespace
inputs.label: Registry or Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A globally unique top-level domain name for your specific registry or namespace.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.
inputs.visibleRule: WebAppKind != app && WebAppKind != functionapp && WebAppKind != api && WebAppKind != mobileapp && ImageSource  = Registry

inputs.name: DockerRepository
inputs.label: Image
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of the repository where the container images are stored.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.
inputs.visibleRule: WebAppKind != app && WebAppKind != functionapp && WebAppKind != api && WebAppKind != mobileapp && ImageSource  = Registry

inputs.name: DockerImageTag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Tags are optional, it is the mechanism that registries use to give Docker images a version.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.
inputs.visibleRule: WebAppKind != app && WebAppKind != functionapp && WebAppKind != api && WebAppKind != mobileapp && ImageSource  = Registry

inputs.name: VirtualApplication
inputs.label: Virtual application
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the Virtual application that has been configured in the Azure portal. The option is not required for deployments to the App Service root.

inputs.name: Package
inputs.label: Package or folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
File path to the package or a folder containing app service contents generated by MSBuild or a compressed zip or war file.
Variables ( [Build](https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/build/define/variables) | [Release](https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/release/author-release-definition/understanding-tasks#predefvariables)), wild cards are supported.
For example, $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.zip or $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.war.

inputs.name: BuiltinLinuxPackage
inputs.label: Package or folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
File path to the package or a folder containing app service contents generated by MSBuild or a compressed zip or war file.
Variables ( [Build](https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/build/define/variables) | [Release](https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/release/author-release-definition/understanding-tasks#predefvariables)), wild cards are supported.
For example, $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.zip or $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.war.
inputs.visibleRule: WebAppKind != app && WebAppKind != functionapp && WebAppKind != api && WebAppKind != mobileapp && ImageSource = Builtin

inputs.name: RuntimeStack
inputs.label: Runtime Stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the framework and version.
inputs.visibleRule: WebAppKind != app && WebAppKind != functionapp && WebAppKind != api && WebAppKind != mobileapp && ImageSource = Builtin

inputs.name: StartupCommand
inputs.label: Startup command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the start up command.

inputs.name: WebAppUri
inputs.label: App Service URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a name for the output variable that is generated for the URL of the Azure App Service. The variable can be consumed in subsequent tasks.

options: Select deployment script type (inline or file)

inputs.name: ScriptType
inputs.label: Deployment script type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Customize the deployment by providing a script that will run on the Azure App service once the task has completed the deployment successfully . For example restore packages for Node, PHP, Python applications. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=843471).

inputs.name: InlineScript
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.defaultValue: :: You can provide your deployment commands here. One command per line.

inputs.name: GenerateWebConfig
inputs.label: Generate Web.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: A standard Web.config will be generated and deployed to Azure App Service if the application does not have one. The values in web.config can be edited and vary based on the application framework. For example for node.js application, web.config will have startup file and iis_node module values. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=843469).

inputs.name: WebConfigParameters
inputs.label: Web.config parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Edit values like startup file in the generated web.config file. This edit feature is only for the generated web.config. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=843469).

inputs.name: AppSettings
inputs.label: App settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app application settings following the syntax -key value . Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -Port 5000 -RequestTimeout 5000
-WEBSITE_TIME_ZONE "Eastern Standard Time"

inputs.name: ConfigurationSettings
inputs.label: Configuration settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app configuration settings following the syntax -key value. Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -phpVersion 5.6 -linuxFxVersion: node|6.11

inputs.name: TakeAppOfflineFlag
inputs.label: Take App Offline
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to take the Azure App Service offline by placing an app_offline.htm file in the root directory of the App Service before the sync operation begins. The file will be removed after the sync operation completes successfully.

inputs.name: UseWebDeploy
inputs.label: Publish using Web Deploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish using Web Deploy options are supported only when using Windows agent. On other platforms, the task relies on [Kudu REST APIs](https://github.com/projectkudu/kudu/wiki/REST-API) to deploy the Azure App Service, and following options are not supported

inputs.name: SetParametersFile
inputs.label: SetParameters file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional: location of the SetParameters.xml file to use.

inputs.name: RemoveAdditionalFilesFlag
inputs.label: Remove additional files at destination
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the option to delete files on the Azure App Service that have no matching files in the App Service package or folder.

Note: This will also remove all files related to any extension installed on this Azure App Service. To prevent this, select 'Exclude files from App_Data folder' checkbox.

inputs.name: ExcludeFilesFromAppDataFlag
inputs.label: Exclude files from the App_Data folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to prevent files in the App_Data folder from being deployed to the Azure App Service.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Additional Web Deploy arguments following the syntax -key:value .
These will be applied when deploying the Azure App Service. Example: -disableLink:AppPoolExtension -disableLink:ContentExtension.
For more examples of Web Deploy operation settings, refer to [this](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=838471).

inputs.name: RenameFilesFlag
inputs.label: Rename locked files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable msdeploy flag MSDEPLOY_RENAME_LOCKED_FILES=1 in Azure App Service application settings. The option if set enables msdeploy to rename locked files that are locked during app deployment

inputs.name: XmlTransformation
inputs.label: XML transformation
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The config transforms will be run for `*.Release.config` and `*..config` on the `*.config file`.
Config transforms will be run prior to the Variable Substitution.
XML transformations are supported only for Windows platform.

inputs.name: XmlVariableSubstitution
inputs.label: XML variable substitution
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Variables defined in the Build or Release Definition will be matched against the 'key' or 'name' entries in the appSettings, applicationSettings, and connectionStrings sections of any config file and parameters.xml. Variable Substitution is run after config transforms.

Note: If same variables are defined in the Release Definition and in the Environment, then the Environment variables will supersede the Release Definition variables.

inputs.name: JSONFiles
inputs.label: JSON variable substitution
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide new line separated list of JSON files to substitute the variable values. Files names are to be provided relative to the root folder.
To substitute JSON variables that are nested or hierarchical, specify them using JSONPath expressions.

For example, to replace the value of ConnectionString in the sample below, you need to define a variable as Data.DefaultConnection.ConnectionString in the build/release definition (or release definitions environment).
{
  "Data": {
    "DefaultConnection": {
      "ConnectionString": "Server=(localdb)\SQLEXPRESS;Database=MyDB;Trusted_Connection=True"
    }
  }
}
Variable Substitution is run after configuration transforms.

Note: Build/Releases system definition variables are excluded in substitution

value.name: AzureRmWebAppDeployment

For example, $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.zip.

inputs.name: WebAppUri
inputs.label: App Service URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a name for the output variable that is generated for the URL of the App Service. The variable can be consumed in subsequent tasks.

inputs.name: UseWebDeploy
inputs.label: Publish using Web Deploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish using web deploy options are supported only when using Windows agent. On other platforms, the task relies on [Kudu REST APIs](https://github.com/projectkudu/kudu/wiki/REST-API) to deploy the App Service, and following options are not supported

inputs.name: SetParametersFile
inputs.label: SetParameters File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional: location of the SetParameters.xml file to use

inputs.name: RemoveAdditionalFilesFlag
inputs.label: Remove Additional Files at Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to delete files on the Azure App Service that have no matching files in the App Service package or folder

inputs.name: ExcludeFilesFromAppDataFlag
inputs.label: Exclude Files from the App_Data Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to prevent files in the App_Data folder from being deployed to the Azure App Service

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Additional Web Deploy arguments following the syntax -key:value.
These will be applied when deploying the Azure App Service. Example: -disableLink:AppPoolExtension -disableLink:ContentExtension.
For more examples of Web Deploy operation settings, refer to [this](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=838471).

inputs.name: TakeAppOfflineFlag
inputs.label: Take App Offline
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to take the Azure App Service offline by placing an app_offline.htm file in the root directory of the App Service before the sync operation begins. The file will be removed after the sync operation completes successfully.

outputVariables.name: AppServiceApplicationUrl
outputVariables.description: Application URL of the selected App Service.

value.name: AzureRmWebAppDeployment
value.description: Update Azure WebApp Services On Windows, Web App On Linux with built-in images or docker containers, ASP.NET, .NET Core, PHP, Python or Node based Web applications, Function Apps, Mobile Apps, Api applications, Web Jobs using Web Deploy / Kudu REST APIs
value.releaseNotes:
What's new in version 4.* (preview)
Supports Kudu Zip Deploy
Supports App Service Environments
Improved UI for discovering different App service types supported by the task
Click [here](https://aka.ms/azurermwebdeployreadme) for more Information.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: FileTransformsAndVariableSubstitution
groups.visibleRule: ConnectionType = PublishProfile || WebAppKind = webApp || WebAppKind = apiApp || WebAppKind = functionApp || WebAppKind = mobileApp

groups.name: AdditionalDeploymentOptions
groups.visibleRule: ConnectionType = AzureRM && WebAppKind != webAppLinux && WebAppKind != webAppContainer && WebAppKind != ""

inputs.name: ConnectionType
inputs.label: Connection type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service connection type to use to deploy the Web App.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: PublishProfilePassword
inputs.label: Publish profile password
inputs.helpMarkDown: It is recommended to store password in a secret variable and use that variable here e.g. $(Password).

inputs.name: WebAppKind
inputs.label: App Service type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose from Web App On Windows, Web App On Linux, Web App for Containers, Function App and Mobile App.

inputs.name: WebAppName
inputs.label: App Service name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select the name of an existing Azure App Service. App services based on selected app type will only be listed.

inputs.name: DeployToSlotOrASEFlag
inputs.label: Deploy to Slot or App Service Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the option to deploy to an existing deployment slot or Azure App Service Environment.
For both the targets, the task needs Resource group name.
In case the deployment target is a slot, by default the deployment is done to the production slot. Any other existing slot name can also be provided.
In case the deployment target is an Azure App Service environment, leave the slot name as production and just specify the Resource group name.

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The Resource group name is required when the deployment target is either a deployment slot or an App Service Environment.
Enter or Select the Azure Resource group that contains the Azure App Service specified above.

inputs.name: SlotName
inputs.label: Slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select an existing Slot other than the Production slot.

inputs.name: DockerNamespace
inputs.label: Registry or Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A globally unique top-level domain name for your specific registry or namespace.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: DockerRepository
inputs.label: Image
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of the repository where the container images are stored.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: DockerImageTag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Tags are optional, it is the mechanism that registries use to give Docker images a version.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: VirtualApplication
inputs.label: Virtual application
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the Virtual application that has been configured in the Azure portal. The option is not required for deployments to the App Service root.
inputs.visibleRule: WebAppKind != webAppLinux && WebAppKind != webAppContainer && WebAppKind != functionApp && WebAppKind != ""

inputs.name: Package
inputs.label: Package or folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
File path to the package or a folder containing app service contents generated by MSBuild or a compressed zip or war file.
Variables ( [Build](https://docs.microsoft.com/vsts/pipelines/build/variables) | [Release](https://docs.microsoft.com/vsts/pipelines/release/variables#default-variables)), wildcards are supported.
For example, $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.zip or $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\*\*/\*.war.
inputs.visibleRule: ConnectionType = PublishProfile || WebAppKind = webApp || WebAppKind = apiApp || WebAppKind = functionApp || WebAppKind = mobileApp || WebAppKind = webAppLinux

inputs.name: RuntimeStack
inputs.label: Runtime Stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the framework and version.

inputs.name: StartupCommand
inputs.label: Startup command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the start up command.

options: Select deployment script type (inline or file)

inputs.name: ScriptType
inputs.label: Deployment script type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Customize the deployment by providing a script that will run on the Azure App service once the task has completed the deployment successfully . For example restore packages for Node, PHP, Python applications. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=843471).

inputs.name: InlineScript
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.defaultValue: :: You can provide your deployment commands here. One command per line.

inputs.name: WebConfigParameters
inputs.label: Generate web.config parameters for Python, Node.js and Go apps
inputs.helpMarkDown: A standard Web.config will be generated and deployed to Azure App Service if the application does not have one. The values in web.config can be edited and vary based on the application framework. For example for node.js application, web.config will have startup file and iis_node module values. This edit feature is only for the generated web.config. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=843469).

inputs.name: AppSettings
inputs.label: App settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app application settings following the syntax -key value . Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -Port 5000 -RequestTimeout 5000
-WEBSITE_TIME_ZONE "Eastern Standard Time"

inputs.name: ConfigurationSettings
inputs.label: Configuration settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app configuration settings following the syntax -key value. Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -phpVersion 5.6 -linuxFxVersion: node|6.11

inputs.name: UseWebDeploy
inputs.label: Select deployment method
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If unchecked we will auto-detect the best deployment method based on your app type, package format and other parameters.
Select the option to view the supported deployment methods and choose one for deploying your app.

inputs.name: DeploymentType
inputs.label: Deployment method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the deployment method for the app.

inputs.name: TakeAppOfflineFlag
inputs.label: Take App Offline
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to take the Azure App Service offline by placing an app_offline.htm file in the root directory of the App Service before the sync operation begins. The file will be removed after the sync operation completes successfully.

inputs.name: SetParametersFile
inputs.label: SetParameters file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional: location of the SetParameters.xml file to use.

inputs.name: RemoveAdditionalFilesFlag
inputs.label: Remove additional files at destination
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the option to delete files on the Azure App Service that have no matching files in the App Service package or folder.

Note: This will also remove all files related to any extension installed on this Azure App Service. To prevent this, select 'Exclude files from App_Data folder' checkbox.

inputs.name: ExcludeFilesFromAppDataFlag
inputs.label: Exclude files from the App_Data folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to prevent files in the App_Data folder from being deployed to the Azure App Service.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Additional Web Deploy arguments following the syntax -key:value .
These will be applied when deploying the Azure App Service. Example: -disableLink:AppPoolExtension -disableLink:ContentExtension.
For more examples of Web Deploy operation settings, refer to [this](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=838471).

inputs.name: RenameFilesFlag
inputs.label: Rename locked files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable msdeploy flag MSDEPLOY_RENAME_LOCKED_FILES=1 in Azure App Service application settings. The option if set enables msdeploy to rename locked files that are locked during app deployment

inputs.name: XmlTransformation
inputs.label: XML transformation
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The config transforms will be run for `*.Release.config` and `*..config` on the `*.config file`.
Config transforms will be run prior to the Variable Substitution.
XML transformations are supported only for Windows platform.

inputs.name: XmlVariableSubstitution
inputs.label: XML variable substitution
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Variables defined in the build or release pipelines will be matched against the 'key' or 'name' entries in the appSettings, applicationSettings, and connectionStrings sections of any config file and parameters.xml. Variable Substitution is run after config transforms.

Note: If same variables are defined in the release pipeline and in the environment, then the environment variables will supersede the release pipeline variables.

inputs.name: JSONFiles
inputs.label: JSON variable substitution
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide new line separated list of JSON files to substitute the variable values. Files names are to be provided relative to the root folder.
To substitute JSON variables that are nested or hierarchical, specify them using JSONPath expressions.

For example, to replace the value of ConnectionString in the sample below, you need to define a variable as Data.DefaultConnection.ConnectionString in the build or release pipeline (or release pipeline's environment).
{
  "Data": {
    "DefaultConnection": {
      "ConnectionString": "Server=(localdb)\SQLEXPRESS;Database=MyDB;Trusted_Connection=True"
    }
  }
}
Variable Substitution is run after configuration transforms.

Note: the build or release's system definition variables are excluded in substitution.

value.name: Ant
value.description: Build with Apache Ant
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: antBuildFile
inputs.label: Ant build file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the Ant build file.

inputs.name: options
inputs.label: Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide any options to pass to the Ant command line. You can provide your own properties (for example, ***-DmyProperty=myPropertyValue***) and also use built-in variables (for example, ***-DcollectionId=$(system.collectionId)***). Alternatively, the built-in variables are already set as environment variables during the build and can be passed directly (for example, ***-DcollectionIdAsEnvVar=%SYSTEM_COLLECTIONID%***).

inputs.name: targets
inputs.label: Target(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: An optional, space-separated list of targets to build. If not specified, the `default` target will be used. If no `default` target is defined, Ant 1.6.0 and later will build all top-level tasks.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to TFS/Team Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Ant build to TFS/Team Services. Each test results file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in TFS/Team Services.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)). For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: codeCoverageTool
inputs.label: Code coverage tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the code coverage tool. For on-premises agent support, refer to the `More Information` link below.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of relative paths from the Ant build file to directories containing class files and archive files (JAR, WAR, etc.). Code coverage is reported for class files in these directories. For example: target/classes,target/testClasses.

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class inclusion/exclusion filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example: +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*.

inputs.name: srcDirectories
inputs.label: Source files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of relative paths from the Ant build file to source code directories. Code coverage reports will use these to highlight source code. For example: src/java,src/Test.

inputs.name: failIfCoverageEmpty
inputs.label: Fail when code coverage results are missing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if code coverage did not produce any results to publish.

inputs.name: antHomeUserInputPath
inputs.label: Set ANT_HOME path
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set, overrides any existing ANT_HOME environment variable with the given path.

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of the JDK.

outputVariables.name: secureFilePath
outputVariables.description: The location of the secure file that was downloaded.

value.name: DownloadSecureFile
value.description: Download a secure file to a temporary location on the build or release agent
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: secureFile
inputs.label: Secure File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the secure file to download to a temporary location on the agent. The file will be cleaned up after the build or release.

value.name: JenkinsDownloadArtifacts
value.description: Download artifacts produced by a Jenkins job
value.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by a [Jenkins](https://jenkins.io/) job.
value.author: Microsoft

inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: Jenkins service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service connection for your Jenkins instance. To create one, click the Manage link and create a new Jenkins service connection.

inputs.name: jobName
inputs.label: Job name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Jenkins job to download artifacts from.  This must exactly match the job name on the Jenkins server.

inputs.name: jenkinsJobType
inputs.label: Jenkins job type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Jenkins job type, detected automatically.

inputs.name: saveTo
inputs.label: Save to
inputs.helpMarkDown: Jenkins artifacts will be downloaded and saved to this directory.  This directory will be created if it does not exist.

inputs.name: jenkinsBuild
inputs.label: Download artifacts produced by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by the last successful build, or from a specific build instance.

inputs.name: jenkinsBuildNumber
inputs.label: Jenkins build number
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by this build.

inputs.name: itemPattern
inputs.label: Item Pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify files to be downloaded as multi line minimatch pattern. [More Information](https://aka.ms/minimatchexamples)

The default pattern (\*\*) will download all files across all artifacts produced by the Jenkins job. To download all files within artifact drop use drop/**.

inputs.name: downloadCommitsAndWorkItems
inputs.label: Download Commits and WorkItems
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enables downloading the commits and work item details associated with the Jenkins Job

inputs.name: startJenkinsBuildNumber
inputs.label: Download commits and work items from
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional start build number for downloading commits and work items. If provided, all commits and work items between start build number and build number given as input to download artifacts will be downloaded.

inputs.name: artifactDetailsFileNameSuffix
inputs.label: Commit and WorkItem FileName
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional file name suffix for commits and work item attachments. Attachments will be created with commits_{suffix}.json and workitem_{suffix}.json. If this input is not provided, attachments will be created with the name commits.json and workitems.json

inputs.name: propagatedArtifacts
inputs.label: Artifacts are propagated to Azure
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this if Jenkins artifacts were propagated to Azure. To upload Jenkins artifacts to azure, refer to this [Jenkins plugin](https://wiki.jenkins.io/display/JENKINS/Windows+Azure+Storage+Plugin)

inputs.name: artifactProvider
inputs.label: Artifact Provider
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the external storage provider used in Jenkins job to upload the artifacts.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the artifacts.

inputs.name: storageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic and Resource Manager stoarge accounts are listed. Select the Storage account name in which the artifacts are propagated.

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container in the storage account to which artifacts are uploaded.

inputs.name: commonVirtualPath
inputs.label: Common Virtual Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the artifacts inside the Azure storage container.

value.name: AzureCloudPowerShellDeployment
value.description: Deploy an Azure Cloud Service
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: newServiceAdvancedOptions
groups.displayName: Advanced Options For Creating New Service

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription (Classic)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic subscription to target for deployment.

inputs.name: StorageAccount
inputs.label: Storage account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Storage account must exist prior to deployment.

inputs.name: ServiceName
inputs.label: Service name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select or enter an existing cloud service name.

inputs.name: ServiceLocation
inputs.label: Service location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a region for new service deployment.Possible options are **East US**, **East US 2**, **Central US**, **South Central US**, **West US**, **North Europe**, **West Europe** and others.

inputs.name: CsPkg
inputs.label: CsPkg
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of CsPkg under the default artifact directory.

inputs.name: CsCfg
inputs.label: CsCfg
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of CsCfg under the default artifact directory.

inputs.name: Slot
inputs.label: Environment (Slot)
inputs.helpMarkDown: **Production** or **Staging**

inputs.name: DeploymentLabel
inputs.label: Deployment label
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the label name for the new deployment. If not specified, a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) is used.

inputs.name: AppendDateTimeToLabel
inputs.label: Append current date and time
inputs.helpMarkDown: Appends current date and time to deployment label

inputs.name: AllowUpgrade
inputs.label: Allow upgrade
inputs.helpMarkDown: When selected allows an upgrade to the Microsoft Azure deployment

inputs.name: SimultaneousUpgrade
inputs.label: Simultaneous upgrade
inputs.helpMarkDown: Updates all instances at once. Your cloud service will be unavailable during update.

inputs.name: ForceUpgrade
inputs.label: Force upgrade
inputs.helpMarkDown: When selected sets the upgrade to a forced upgrade, which could potentially cause loss of local data.

inputs.name: DiagnosticStorageAccountKeys
inputs.label: Diagnostic storage account keys
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide storage keys for diagnostics storage account in Role:Storagekey format. The diagnostics storage account name for each role will be obtained from diagnostics config file (.wadcfgx). If the .wadcfgx file for a role is not found, diagnostics extensions wont be set for the role. If the storage account name is missing in the .wadcfgx file, the default storage account will be used for storing diagnostics results and the storage key parameters from deployment task will be ignored. Its recommended to save as a secret variable unless there is no sensitive information in the diagnostics result for your environment.

For example,
WebRole: <WebRole_storage_account_key>
WorkerRole: <WorkerRole_stoarge_account_key>

inputs.name: NewServiceCustomCertificates
inputs.label: Custom certificates to import
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide custom certificates in CertificatePfxBase64:CertificatePassword format. Its recommended to save as a secret variable.

For example,
Certificate1: <Certificate1_password>
Certificate2: <Certificate2_password>

inputs.name: NewServiceAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pass in additional arguments while creating a brand new service. These will be passed on to `New-AzureService` cmdlet. Eg: `-Label 'MyTestService'`

inputs.name: NewServiceAffinityGroup
inputs.label: Affinity group
inputs.helpMarkDown: While creating new service, this affinity group will be considered instead of using service location.

value.name: IISWebAppManagementOnMachineGroup
value.description: Create or update a Website, Web App, Virtual Directories, and Application Pool
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: IISBindings
groups.visibleRule: IISDeploymentType = IISWebsite && ActionIISWebsite = CreateOrUpdateWebsite && AddBinding = true

groups.name: ApplicationPoolForWebsite
groups.visibleRule: IISDeploymentType = IISWebsite && ActionIISWebsite = CreateOrUpdateWebsite && CreateOrUpdateAppPoolForWebsite = true

groups.name: IISWebsiteAuthentication
groups.visibleRule: IISDeploymentType = IISWebsite && ActionIISWebsite = CreateOrUpdateWebsite && ConfigureAuthenticationForWebsite = true

inputs.name: EnableIIS
inputs.label: Enable IIS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this if you want to install IIS on the machine.

inputs.name: IISDeploymentType
inputs.label: Configuration type
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can create or update sites, applications, virtual directories, and application pools.

inputs.name: ActionIISWebsite
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the appropriate action that you want to perform on an IIS website. 

"Create Or Update" will create a website or update an existing website.

 Start, Stop will start or stop the website respectively.

inputs.name: ActionIISApplicationPool
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the appropriate action that you want to perform on an IIS Application Pool. 

"Create Or Update" will create app-pool or update an existing one.

Start, Stop, Recycle will start, stop or recycle the application pool respectively.

inputs.name: StartStopWebsiteName
inputs.label: Website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS website.

inputs.name: WebsiteName
inputs.label: Website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS website to create or update.

inputs.name: WebsitePhysicalPath
inputs.label: Physical path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the physical path where the website content will be stored. The content can reside on the local Computer, or in a remote directory, or on a network share, like C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: WebsitePhysicalPathAuth
inputs.label: Physical path authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mechanism that will be used to access the physical path of the website.

inputs.name: WebsiteAuthUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the user name that will be used to access the website's physical path.

inputs.name: WebsiteAuthUserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the user's password that will be used to access the website's physical path.
The best practice is to create a variable in the build or release pipeline, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(userCredentials)'.
Note: Special characters in password are interpreted as per command-line arguments

inputs.name: AddBinding
inputs.label: Add binding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to add port binding for the website.

inputs.name: Protocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select HTTP for the website to have an HTTP binding, or select HTTPS for the website to have a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) binding.

inputs.name: IPAddress
inputs.label: IP address
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide an IP address that end-users can use to access this website.
If 'All Unassigned' is selected, then the website will respond to requests for all IP addresses on the port and for the host name, unless another website on the server has a binding on the same port but with a specific IP address.

inputs.name: Port
inputs.label: Port
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the port, where the Hypertext Transfer Protocol Stack (HTTP.sys) will listen to the website requests.

inputs.name: ServerNameIndication
inputs.label: Server Name Indication required
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the option to set the Server Name Indication (SNI) for the website.
SNI extends the SSL and TLS protocols to indicate the host name that the clients are attempting to connect to. It allows, multiple secure websites with different certificates, to use the same IP address.

inputs.name: HostNameWithOutSNI
inputs.label: Host name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter a host name (or domain name) for the website.
If a host name is specified, then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithHttp
inputs.label: Host name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter a host name (or domain name) for the website.
If a host name is specified, then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithSNI
inputs.label: Host name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter a host name (or domain name) for the website.
If a host name is specified, then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: SSLCertThumbPrint
inputs.label: SSL certificate thumbprint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the thumb-print of the Secure Socket Layer certificate that the website is going to use for the HTTPS communication as a 40 character long hexadecimal string. The SSL certificate should be already installed on the Computer, at Local Computer, Personal store.

inputs.name: Bindings
inputs.label: Add bindings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Click on the extension [...] button to add bindings for the website.

inputs.name: CreateOrUpdateAppPoolForWebsite
inputs.label: Create or update app pool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create or update an application pool. If checked, the website will be created in the specified app pool.

inputs.name: ConfigureAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Configure authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to configure authentication for website.

inputs.name: AppPoolNameForWebsite
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS application pool to create or update.

inputs.name: DotNetVersionForWebsite
inputs.label: .NET version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the version of the .NET Framework that is loaded by the application pool.
If the applications assigned to this application pool do not contain managed code, then select the 'No Managed Code' option from the list.

inputs.name: PipeLineModeForWebsite
inputs.label: Managed pipeline mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the managed pipeline mode that specifies how IIS processes requests for managed content. Use classic mode only when the applications in the application pool cannot run in the Integrated mode.

inputs.name: AppPoolIdentityForWebsite
inputs.label: Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the account under which an application pool's worker process runs. Select one of the predefined security accounts or configure a custom account.

inputs.name: AppPoolUsernameForWebsite
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the username of the custom account that you want to use.

inputs.name: AppPoolPasswordForWebsite
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the password for custom account.
The best practice is to create a variable in the build or release pipeline, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(userCredentials)'.
Note: Special characters in password are interpreted as per command-line arguments

inputs.name: AnonymousAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Anonymous authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable anonymous authentication for website.

inputs.name: BasicAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Basic authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable basic authentication for website.

inputs.name: WindowsAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Windows authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable windows authentication for website.

inputs.name: ParentWebsiteNameForVD
inputs.label: Parent website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the parent Website of the virtual directory.

inputs.name: VirtualPathForVD
inputs.label: Virtual path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the virtual path of the virtual directory. 

Example: To create a virtual directory Site/Application/VDir enter /Application/Vdir. The parent website and application should be already existing.

inputs.name: PhysicalPathForVD
inputs.label: Physical path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the physical path where the virtual directory's content will be stored. The content can reside on the local Computer, or in a remote directory, or on a network share, like C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: VDPhysicalPathAuth
inputs.label: Physical path authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mechanism that will be used to access the physical path of the virtual directory.

inputs.name: VDAuthUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the user name that will be used to access the virtual directory's physical path.

inputs.name: VDAuthUserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the user's password that will be used to access the virtual directory's physical path.
The best practice is to create a variable in the build or release pipeline, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(userCredentials)'.
Note: Special characters in password are interpreted as per command-line arguments

inputs.name: ParentWebsiteNameForApplication
inputs.label: Parent website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the parent Website under which the application will be created or updated.

inputs.name: VirtualPathForApplication
inputs.label: Virtual path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the virtual path of the application. 

Example: To create an application Site/Application enter /Application. The parent website should be already existing.

inputs.name: PhysicalPathForApplication
inputs.label: Physical path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the physical path where the application's content will be stored. The content can reside on the local Computer, or in a remote directory, or on a network share, like C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: ApplicationPhysicalPathAuth

inputs.name: ApplicationAuthUserName

inputs.name: ApplicationAuthUserPassword

Provide the user's password that will be used to access the application's physical path.
The best practice is to create a variable in the build or release pipeline, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(userCredentials)'.
Note: Special characters in password are interpreted as per command-line arguments

value.name: CopyFilesOverSSH
value.description: Copy files or build artifacts to a remote machine over SSH
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: sshEndpoint
inputs.label: SSH service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: SSH service connection with connection details for the remote machine.

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder of the files to copy to the remote machine.  When empty, the root of the repository (build) or artifacts directory (release) is used, which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).  Use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) if files are not in the repository. Example: $(Agent.BuildDirectory)

inputs.name: contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: File paths to include as part of the copy. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns. [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=821894)

inputs.name: targetFolder
inputs.label: Target folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target folder on the remote machine to where files will be copied. Example: /home/user/MySite.

inputs.name: cleanTargetFolder
inputs.label: Clean target folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete all existing files and subfolders in the target folder before copying.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace existing files in and beneath the target folder.

inputs.name: failOnEmptySource
inputs.label: Fail if no files found to copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail if no matching files to be copied are found under the source folder.

inputs.name: flattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder on the remote machine.

value.instanceNameFormat: Securely copy files to the remote machine

value.name: ArchiveFiles
value.description: Archive files using compression formats such as .7z, .rar, .tar.gz, and .zip.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: rootFolderOrFile
inputs.label: Root folder or file to archive
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the root folder or file path to add to the archive. If a folder, everything under the folder will be added to the resulting archive.

inputs.name: includeRootFolder
inputs.label: Prepend root folder name to archive paths
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If selected, the root folder name will be prepended to file paths within the archive. Otherwise, all file paths will start one level lower.

For example, suppose the selected root folder is: `/home/user/output/classes/`, and contains: `com/acme/Main.class`.

  • If selected, the resulting archive would contain: `classes/com/acme/Main.class`.
  • Otherwise, the resulting archive would contain: `com/acme/Main.class`.

inputs.name: archiveType
inputs.label: Archive type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the compression scheme used. To create `foo.jar`, for example, choose `zip` for the compression, and specify `foo.jar` as the archive file to create. For all tar files (including compressed ones), choose `tar`.

inputs.name: tarCompression
inputs.label: Tar compression
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally choose a compression scheme, or choose `None` to create an uncompressed tar file.

inputs.name: archiveFile
inputs.label: Archive file to create
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the archive file to create. For example, to create `foo.tgz`, select the `tar` archive type and `gz` for tar compression.

inputs.name: replaceExistingArchive
inputs.label: Replace existing archive
inputs.helpMarkDown: If an existing archive exists, specify whether to overwrite it.  Otherwise, files will be added to it.

value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.helpMarkDown:

For example, suppose the selected root folder is: `/home/user/output/classes/`, and contains: `com/acme/Main.class`.

  • If selected, the resulting archive would contain: `classes/com/acme/Main.class`.
  • Otherwise, the resulting archive would contain: `com/acme/Main.class`.

inputs.name: archiveType
inputs.label: Archive type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the compression scheme used. To create `foo.jar`, for example, choose `zip` for the compression, and specify `foo.jar` as the archive file to create. For all tar files (including compressed ones), choose `tar`.

inputs.name: tarCompression
inputs.label: Tar compression
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally choose a compression scheme, or choose `None` to create an uncompressed tar file.

inputs.name: archiveFile
inputs.label: Archive file to create
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the archive file to create. For example, to create `foo.tgz`, select the `tar` archive type and `gz` for tar compression.

inputs.name: replaceExistingArchive

value.name: XamarinComponentRestore
value.description: This task is deprecated. Use 'NuGet' instead.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Path to solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the Visual Studio Solution file

inputs.name: email
inputs.label: Email
inputs.helpMarkDown: Xamarin account email address.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Xamarin account password. Use a new build variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

value.name: ServiceFabricDeploy
value.description: Deploy a Service Fabric application to a cluster.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: applicationPackagePath
inputs.label: Application Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the application package that is to be deployed. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path.

inputs.name: serviceConnectionName
inputs.label: Cluster Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Service Fabric service connection to be used to connect to the cluster. The settings defined in this referenced service connection will override those defined in the publish profile. Choose 'Manage' to register a new service connection.

inputs.name: publishProfilePath
inputs.label: Publish Profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the publish profile file that defines the settings to use. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path.

inputs.name: applicationParameterPath
inputs.label: Application Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the application parameters file. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path. If specified, this will override the value in the publish profile.

inputs.name: overrideApplicationParameter
inputs.label: Override Application Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Variables defined in the build or release pipeline will be matched against the 'Parameter Name' entries in the application manifest file. 
 Example: If your application has a parameter defined as below. 
 <Parameters> 
 <Parameter Name="SampleApp_PartitionCount" Value="1" /> 
 <Parameter Name="SampleApp_InstanceCount" DefaultValue="-1" /> 
 </Parameters> 
 and you want to change the partition count to 2, you can define a release pipeline or an environment variable "SampleApp_PartitionCount" and its value as "2". 

 Note: If same variables are defined in the release pipeline and in the environment, then the environment variables will supersede the release pipeline variables.

inputs.name: compressPackage
inputs.label: Compress Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether the application package should be compressed before copying to the image store. If enabled, this will override the value in the publish profile.

inputs.name: copyPackageTimeoutSec
inputs.label: CopyPackageTimeoutSec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for copying application package to image store. If specified, this will override the value in the publish profile.

inputs.name: registerPackageTimeoutSec
inputs.label: RegisterPackageTimeoutSec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for registering or un-registering application package.

inputs.name: overwriteBehavior
inputs.label: Overwrite Behavior
inputs.helpMarkDown: Overwrite Behavior if an application exists in the cluster with the same name, and upgrades have not been configured.

inputs.name: skipUpgradeSameTypeAndVersion
inputs.label: Skip upgrade for same Type and Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether an upgrade will be skipped if the same application type and version already exists in the cluster, otherwise the upgrade fails during validation. If enabled, re-deployments are idempotent.

inputs.name: skipPackageValidation
inputs.label: Skip package validation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether the package should be validated or not before deployment.

inputs.name: useDiffPackage
inputs.label: Use Diff Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upgrade by using a diff package that contains only the updated application files, the updated application manifest, and the service manifest files.

inputs.name: overridePublishProfileSettings
inputs.label: Override All Publish Profile Upgrade Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: This will override all upgrade settings with either the values specified below or the default value if not specified.

inputs.name: unregisterUnusedVersions
inputs.label: Unregister Unused Versions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether all unused versions of the application type will be removed after an upgrade.

inputs.name: FailureAction
inputs.label: FailureAction
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: HealthCheckRetryTimeoutSec
inputs.label: HealthCheckRetryTimeoutSec
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: HealthCheckWaitDurationSec
inputs.label: HealthCheckWaitDurationSec
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: HealthCheckStableDurationSec
inputs.label: HealthCheckStableDurationSec
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: UpgradeDomainTimeoutSec
inputs.label: UpgradeDomainTimeoutSec
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: ConsiderWarningAsError
inputs.label: ConsiderWarningAsError
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: DefaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy
inputs.label: DefaultServiceTypeHealthPolicy
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: MaxPercentUnhealthyDeployedApplications
inputs.label: MaxPercentUnhealthyDeployedApplications
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: UpgradeTimeoutSec
inputs.label: UpgradeTimeoutSec
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: ServiceTypeHealthPolicyMap
inputs.label: ServiceTypeHealthPolicyMap
inputs.visibleRule: overridePublishProfileSettings = true && isUpgrade = true && upgradeMode = Monitored

inputs.name: configureDockerSettings
inputs.label: Configure Docker settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configures the application with the specified Docker settings.

inputs.name: registryCredentials
inputs.label: Registry Credentials Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose how credentials for the Docker registry will be provided.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.
Note: task will try to encrypt the registry secret before transmitting it to service fabric cluster. However, it needs cluster's server certiticate to be installed on agent machine in order to do so. If certificate is not present, secret will not be encrypted.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select an Azure subscription.
Note: task will try to encrypt the registry secret before transmitting it to service fabric cluster. However, it needs cluster's server certiticate to be installed on agent machine in order to do so. If certificate is not present, secret will not be encrypted.

inputs.name: registryUserName
inputs.label: Registry User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username for the Docker registry

inputs.name: registryPassword
inputs.label: Registry Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the Docker registry. If the password is not encrypted, it is recommended that you use a custom release pipeline secret variable to store it.

inputs.name: passwordEncrypted
inputs.label: Password Encrypted
inputs.helpMarkDown: It is recommended to encrypt your password using [Invoke-ServiceFabricEncryptText](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-application-secret-management#encrypt-application-secrets). If you do not, and a certificate matching the Server Certificate Thumbprint in the Cluster Service Connection is installed on the build agent, it will be used to encrypt the password; otherwise an error will occur.

outputVariables.name: rubyLocation
outputVariables.description: The resolved folder of the Ruby distribution.

inputs.name: addToPath

echo Write your commands here

inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

value.name: CmdLine

Note: You can use **$(Build.SourcesDirectory)**\\ if you want the path relative to repo.

inputs.name: arguments

inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the tool. Use double quotes to escape spaces.

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

value.name: Delay

value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: delayForMinutes
