inputs.helpMarkDown: Delay the execution of the workflow by specified time in minutes.

value.name: AzureResourceGroupDeployment
value.description: Deploy, start, stop, delete Azure Resource Groups
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameClassic
inputs.label: Azure Classic Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Classic subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on the Azure resources or resource group.

inputs.name: actionClassic
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on the Azure resources or cloud service.

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the resource group.

inputs.name: cloudService
inputs.label: Cloud Service
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the cloud service.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location for deploying the resource group. If the resource group already exists in the subscription, then this value will be ignored.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: csmFile
inputs.label: Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to the Azure Resource Manager template. For more information about the templates see https://aka.ms/azuretemplates. To get started immediately use template https://aka.ms/sampletemplate.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: csmParametersFile
inputs.label: Template Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path for the parameters file for the Azure Resource Manager Template.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: overrideParameters
inputs.label: Override Template Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the template parameters to override like,
-storageName fabrikam -adminUsername $(vmusername) -adminPassword (ConvertTo-SecureString -String '$(password)' -AsPlainText -Force) -azureKeyVaultName $(fabrikamFibre).
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: deploymentMode
inputs.label: Deployment Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Incremental mode handles deployments as incremental updates to the resource group . It leaves unchanged resources that exist in the resource group but are not specified in the template. 

 Complete mode deletes resources that are not in your template. 

 Validate mode enables you to find problems with the template before creating actual resources. 

 By default, Incremental mode is used.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: enableDeploymentPrerequisitesForCreate
inputs.label: Enable Deployment Prerequisites
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing deployment operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986).
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: enableDeploymentPrerequisitesForSelect
inputs.label: Enable Deployment Prerequisites
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing deployment operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986).

inputs.name: outputVariable
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a name for the variable for the resource group. The variable can be used as $(variableName) to refer to the resource group in subsequent tasks like in the PowerShell on Target Machines task for deploying applications.
Valid only when the selected action is Create, Update or Select, and required when an existing resource group is selected.

value.name: AzureResourceGroupDeployment
value.description: Deploy an Azure resource manager (ARM) template to a resource group. You can also start, stop, delete, deallocate all Virtual Machines (VM) in a resource group
value.releaseNotes:
-Works with cross-platform agents (Linux, macOS, or Windows)
- Supports Template JSONs located at any publicly accessible http/https URLs.
- Enhanced UX for Override parameters which can now be viewed/edited in a grid.
- NAT rule mapping for VMs which are backed by an Load balancer.
- "Resource group" field is now renamed as "VM details forWinRM" and is included in the section"Advanced deployment options for virtual machines".
- Limitations: 
 - No support for Classic subscriptions. Only for ARM subscriptions are supported.
 - No support for PowerShell syntax as the task is now node.js based. Ensure the case sensitivity of the parameter names match, when you override the template parameters. Also, remove the PowerShell cmdlets like "ConvertTo-SecureString" when you migrate from version 1.0 to version 2.0.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: Template
groups.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

groups.name: AdvancedDeploymentOptions
groups.displayName: Advanced deployment options for virtual machines
groups.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group || action = Select Resource Group

groups.name: Outputs
groups.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on the Azure resources or resource group.

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of a resource group.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location for deploying the resource group. If the resource group already exists in the subscription, then this value will be ignored.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: csmFileLink
inputs.label: Template link
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the URL of the template file. Example: [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure/...](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/master/101-vm-simple-windows/azuredeploy.json) 

To deploy a template stored in a private storage account, retrieve and include the shared access signature (SAS) token in the URL of the template. Example: `<blob_storage_url>/template.json?<SAStoken>` To upload a template file (or a linked template) to a storage account and generate a SAS token, you could use [Azure file copy](https://aka.ms/azurefilecopyreadme) task or follow the steps using [PowerShell](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=838080) or [Azure CLI](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=836911).

To  view the template parameters in a grid, click on  next to Override template parameters text box. This feature requires that CORS rules are enabled at the source. If templates are in Azure storage blob, refer to [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/fileservices/Cross-Origin-Resource-Sharing--CORS--Support-for-the-Azure-Storage-Services?redirectedfrom=MSDN#understanding-cors-requests) to enable CORS.

inputs.name: csmParametersFileLink
inputs.label: Template parameters link
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the URL of the parameters file. Example: [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure/...](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/master/101-vm-simple-windows/azuredeploy.parameters.json) 

To use a file stored in a private storage account, retrieve and include the shared access signature (SAS) token in the URL of the template. Example: `<blob_storage_url>/template.json?<SAStoken>` To upload a parameters file to a storage account and generate a SAS token, you could use [Azure file copy](https://aka.ms/azurefilecopyreadme) task or follow the steps using [PowerShell](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=838080) or [Azure CLI](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=836911). 

To  view the template parameters in a grid, click on  next to Override template parameters text box. This feature requires that CORS rules are enabled at the source. If templates are in Azure storage blob, refer to [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/fileservices/Cross-Origin-Resource-Sharing--CORS--Support-for-the-Azure-Storage-Services?redirectedfrom=MSDN#understanding-cors-requests) to enable CORS.

inputs.name: csmFile
inputs.label: Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path or a pattern pointing to the Azure Resource Manager template. For more information about the templates see https://aka.ms/azuretemplates. To get started immediately use template https://aka.ms/sampletemplate.

inputs.name: csmParametersFile
inputs.label: Template parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path or a pattern pointing for the parameters file for the Azure Resource Manager template.

inputs.name: overrideParameters
inputs.label: Override template parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
To view the template parameters in a grid, click on next to Override Parameters textbox. This feature requires that CORS rules are enabled at the source. If templates are in Azure storage blob, refer to [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/fileservices/Cross-Origin-Resource-Sharing--CORS--Support-for-the-Azure-Storage-Services?redirectedfrom=MSDN#understanding-cors-requests) to enable CORS. Or type the template parameters to override in the textbox. Example,
storageName fabrikam adminUsername $(vmusername) -adminPassword $(password) azureKeyVaultName $(fabrikamFibre).
If the parameter value you're using has multiple words, enclose them in quotes, even if you're passing them using variables. For example, -name "parameter value" -name2 "$(var)"
To override object type parameters use stringified JSON objects. For example, -options ["option1"] -map {"key1": "value1" }.

inputs.name: deploymentMode
inputs.label: Deployment mode
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Incremental mode handles deployments as incremental updates to the resource group . It leaves unchanged resources that exist in the resource group but are not specified in the template. 

 Complete mode deletes resources that are not in your template. 

 Validate mode enables you to find problems with the template before creating actual resources. 

 By default, Incremental mode is used.

inputs.name: enableDeploymentPrerequisites
inputs.label: Enable prerequisites
inputs.helpMarkDown:
These options would be applicable only when the Resource group contains virtual machines.

Choosing Deployment Group option would configure Deployment Group agent on each of the virtual machines.

Selecting WinRM option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing deployment operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986).

inputs.name: deploymentGroupEndpoint
inputs.label: VSTS/TFS service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the service connection to connect to a VSTS/TFS account for agent registration.

You can create a service connection using "+New", and select "Token-based authentication". You need a [personal access token(PAT)](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=vsts) to setup a service connection.

Click "Manage" to update the service connection details.

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Team project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Team Project which has the Deployment Group defined in it

inputs.name: deploymentGroupName
inputs.label: Deployment Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Deployment Group against which the agent(s) will be registered. For more guidance, refer to [Deployment Groups](https://aka.ms/832442)

inputs.name: copyAzureVMTags
inputs.label: Copy Azure VM tags to agents
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Choose if the tags configured on the Azure VM need to be copied to the corresponding Deployment Group agent.

By default all Azure tags will be copied following the format Key: Value. Example: An Azure Tag Role : Web would be copied as-is to the Agent machine.

For more information on how tag Azure resources refer to [link](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-group-using-tags)

inputs.name: runAgentServiceAsUser
inputs.label: Run agent service as a user
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Decide whether to run the agent service as a user other than the default.
The default user is "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" in Windows and "root" in Linux.

inputs.name: userName
inputs.label: User name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The username to run the agent service on the virtual machines.
For domain users, please enter values as "domain\username" or "username@domain.com". For local users, please enter just the user name.
It is assumed that the same domain user\a local user with the same name, respectively, is present on all the virtual machines in the resource group.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The password for the user to run the agent service on the Windows VMs.
It is assumed that the password is the same for the specified user on all the VMs.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'. You may mark variable as 'secret' to secure it.
For linux VMs, a password is not required and will be ignored.

inputs.name: outputVariable
inputs.label: VM details for WinRM
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a name for the variable for the resource group. The variable can be used as $(variableName) to refer to the resource group in subsequent tasks like in the PowerShell on Target Machines task for deploying applications.
Valid only when the selected action is Create, Update or Select, and required when an existing resource group is selected.

inputs.name: deploymentOutputs
inputs.label: Deployment outputs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the variable for the output variable which will contain the outputs section of the current deployment object in string format. You can use the ConvertFrom-Json PowerShell cmdlet to parse the JSON object and access the individual output values.

value.name: AzureFunction
value.description: Invoke Azure function as a part of your process.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: function
inputs.label: Azure function url
inputs.helpMarkDown: Url of the Azure function that needs to be invoked. Example:- https://azurefunctionapp.azurewebsites.net/api/HttpTriggerJS1

inputs.name: key
inputs.label: Function key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Function or Host key with which we can access this function. To keep the key secure, define a secret variable and use it here. Example: - $(myFunctionKey) where myFunctionKey is an environment level secret variable with value as the secret key like ZxPXnIEODXLRzYwCw1TgZ4osMfoKs9Zn6se6X/N0FnztfDvZbdOmYw==

inputs.name: method
inputs.label: Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the http method with which the funtion should be invoked with.

inputs.name: headers
inputs.label: Headers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define header in JSON format. The header shall be attached with request to be sent.

inputs.name: queryParameters
inputs.label: Query parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Query parameters string append to the function Url. Should not start with with "?" and "&".

inputs.name: body
inputs.label: Body
inputs.helpMarkDown: JSON formatted message body for the request.

inputs.name: waitForCompletion
inputs.label: Complete based on
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default value "ApiResponse". Available values :  "ApiResponse", "Callback" call where the Azure function calls back to update the timeline record.

inputs.name: successCriteria
inputs.label: Success criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Criteria which defines when to pass the task. No criteria means response content does not influence the result. Example:- For response {"status" : "successful"}, the expression can be eq(root['status'], 'successful'). [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=842996)

inputs.name: cleanDestinationFolder

inputs.helpMarkDown: Fileshare path e.g \\server\folder

inputs.name: artifactName

inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the artifact to download e.g drop

inputs.name: itemPattern
inputs.label: Matching pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify files to be downloaded as multi line minimatch pattern. [More Information](https://aka.ms/minimatchexamples)

The default pattern (\*\*) will download all files within the artifact.

inputs.name: downloadPath

inputs.name: parallelizationLimit

value.name: IISWebAppDeploymentOnMachineGroup
value.description: Deploy a Website or Web Application using WebDeploy
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: WebSiteName
inputs.label: Website Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of an existing website on the machine group machines

inputs.name: VirtualApplication
inputs.label: Virtual Application
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of an already existing Virtual Application on the target Machines

inputs.name: Package
inputs.label: Package or Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
File path to the package or a folder generated by MSBuild or a compressed archive file.
Variables ( [Build](https://docs.microsoft.com/vsts/pipelines/build/variables) | [Release](https://docs.microsoft.com/vsts/pipelines/release/variables#default-variables)), wildcards are supported.
For example, $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\\\*\*\\\*.zip.

inputs.name: SetParametersFile
inputs.label: SetParameters File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional: location of the SetParameters.xml file to use.

inputs.name: RemoveAdditionalFilesFlag
inputs.label: Remove Additional Files at Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to delete files on the Web App that have no matching files in the Web App zip package.

inputs.name: ExcludeFilesFromAppDataFlag
inputs.label: Exclude Files from the App_Data Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to prevent files in the App_Data folder from being deployed to the Web App.

inputs.name: TakeAppOfflineFlag
inputs.label: Take App Offline
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to take the Web App offline by placing an app_offline.htm file in the root directory of the Web App before the sync operation begins. The file will be removed after the sync operation completes successfully.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Web Deploy arguments that will be applied when deploying the Azure Web App like,-disableLink:AppPoolExtension -disableLink:ContentExtension.

inputs.name: XmlTransformation
inputs.label: XML transformation
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The config transforms will be run for `*.Release.config` and `*..config` on the `*.config file`.
Config transforms will be run prior to the Variable Substitution.
XML transformations are supported only for Windows platform.

inputs.name: XmlVariableSubstitution
inputs.label: XML variable substitution
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Variables defined in the build or release pipeline will be matched against the 'key' or 'name' entries in the appSettings, applicationSettings, and connectionStrings sections of any config file and parameters.xml. Variable Substitution is run after config transforms.

Note: If same variables are defined in the release pipeline and in the environment, then the environment variables will supersede the release pipeline variables.

inputs.name: JSONFiles
inputs.label: JSON variable substitution
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide new line separated list of JSON files to substitute the variable values. Files names are to be provided relative to the root folder.
To substitute JSON variables that are nested or hierarchical, specify them using JSONPath expressions.

For example, to replace the value of ConnectionString in the sample below, you need to define a variable as Data.DefaultConnection.ConnectionString in the build or release pipeline (or release pipeline's environment).
{
  "Data": {
    "DefaultConnection": {
      "ConnectionString": "Server=(localdb)\SQLEXPRESS;Database=MyDB;Trusted_Connection=True"
    }
  }
}
Variable Substitution is run after configuration transforms.

Note: The build or releases system definition variables are excluded in substitution.

E.g. if the template has a variable named "drop-location", then add a parameter here with name "drop-location" and a value which you want to use. You can link the value to a release variable as well. To view/edit the additional parameters in a grid, click on "" next to text box.

inputs.name: storageAccountName

inputs.name: azureResourceGroup

inputs.name: baseImageSource

inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the source of base image. You can either choose from a curated gallery of OS images or provide URL of your custom image.

inputs.name: baseImage

inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose from curated list of OS images. This will be used for installing pre-requisite(s) and application(s) before capturing machine image.

inputs.name: customImageUrl
inputs.label: Base image URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify URL of base image. This will be used for installing pre-requisite(s) and application(s) before capturing machine image.

inputs.name: packagePath
inputs.label: Deployment Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path for deployment package directory relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory). Supports minimatch pattern. Example path: FrontendWebApp/**/GalleryApp

inputs.name: deployScriptPath
inputs.label: Deployment script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the relative path to powershell script(for Windows) or shell script(for Linux) which deploys the package. This script should be contained in the package path selected above. Supports minimatch pattern. Example path: deploy/**/scripts/windows/deploy.ps1

inputs.name: deployScriptArguments
inputs.label: Deployment script arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the arguments to be passed to deployment script.

inputs.name: additionalBuilderParameters
inputs.label: Additional Builder parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
In auto generated Packer template mode the task creates a Packer template with an Azure builder. This builder is used to generate a machine image. You can add keys to the Azure builder to customize the generated Packer template. For example setting ssh_tty=true in case you are using a CentOS base image and you need to have a tty to run sudo.
To view/edit the additional parameters in a grid, click on next to text box.

inputs.name: skipTempFileCleanupDuringVMDeprovision
inputs.label: Skip temporary file cleanup during deprovision
inputs.helpMarkDown: During deprovisioning of VM, skip clean-up of temporary files uploaded to VM. Refer [here](https://www.packer.io/docs/builders/azure.html#skip_clean)

inputs.name: imageUri
inputs.label: Image URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the output variable which will store generated machine image URL.

value.name: IISWebAppDeployment
value.description: Deploy by MSDeploy, create/update website & app pools
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: WinRMProtocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). Default is HTTPS.

inputs.name: TestCertificate
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate by a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: WebDeployPackage
inputs.label: Web Deploy Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the Web Deploy (MSDeploy) zip file on the target machines or on a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\WebDeploy\WebDeployPackage.zip. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported like, $env:windir, $env:systemroot, like, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\Web.

inputs.name: WebDeployParamFile
inputs.label: Web Deploy Parameter File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the Parameter file on the target machines or on a UNC path. Parameter file is used to override Web application configuration settings like, IIS Web application name or database connection string.

inputs.name: OverRideParams
inputs.label: Override Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Parameters specified here will override the parameters in the MSDeploy zip file and the Parameter file. To override more than one parameter use line separator, e.g.,
"IIS Web Application Name"="Fabrikam"
"ConnectionString"="Server=localhost;Database=Fabrikam;"

inputs.name: CreateWebSite
inputs.label: Create or Update Website
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create a website or to update an existing website.

inputs.name: WebSiteName
inputs.label: Website Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the IIS website that will be created if it does not exist, or it will be updated if it is already present on the IIS server. The name of the website should be same as that specified in the web deploy zip package file. If a Parameter file and override Parameters setting is also specified, then the name of the website should be same as that in the override Parameters setting.

inputs.name: WebSitePhysicalPath
inputs.label: Physical Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Physical path where the website content is stored. The content can reside on the local computer or on a remote directory or share like, C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: WebSitePhysicalPathAuth
inputs.label: Physical Path Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authentication mechanism for accessing the physical path of the website.

inputs.name: WebSiteAuthUserName
inputs.label: User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: User name for accessing the website's physical path.

inputs.name: WebSiteAuthUserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for accessing the website's physical path. If you are using a gMSA, this is not required.

inputs.name: AddBinding
inputs.label: Add Binding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to add port binding for the website.

inputs.name: AssignDuplicateBinding
inputs.label: Assign Duplicate Binding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to add the bindings specified here, even if there is another website with the same bindings. If there are binding conflicts, then only one of the website will start.

inputs.name: Protocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select HTTP for the website to have an HTTP binding, or select HTTPS for the website to have a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) binding.

inputs.name: IPAddress
inputs.label: IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type an IP address that users can use to access this website. If All Unassigned is selected, the site will respond to requests for all IP addresses on the port and the optional host name that is specified for this site, unless another site on the server has a binding on the same port but with a specific IP address.

inputs.name: Port
inputs.label: Port
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type the port on which Hypertext Transfer Protocol Stack (HTTP.sys) must listen for requests made to this website.

inputs.name: ServerNameIndication
inputs.label: Server Name Indication Required
inputs.helpMarkDown: Determines whether the website requires Server Name Indication (SNI). SNI extends the SSL and TLS protocols to indicate what host name the client is attempting to connect to. It allows multiple secure websites with different certificates to use the same IP address.

inputs.name: HostNameWithOutSNI
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: To assign one or more host names (or domain names) to a computer that uses a single IP address, type a host name here. If a host name is specified then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithHttp
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: To assign one or more host names (or domain names) to a computer that uses a single IP address, type a host name here. If a host name is specified then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithSNI
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: To assign one or more host names (or domain names) to a computer that uses a single IP address, type a host name here. If a host name is specified then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: SSLCertThumbPrint
inputs.label: SSL Certificate Thumb Print
inputs.helpMarkDown: Thumb-print of the Secure Socket Layer certificate that the website is going to use. The certificate should be already installed on the machine and present under the Local Computer, Personal store.

inputs.name: CreateAppPool
inputs.label: Create or Update Application Pool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create an application pool or to update an existing application pool.

inputs.name: AppPoolName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the IIS application pool to create or update. Existing application pool will be updated with the settings specified here.

inputs.name: DotNetVersion
inputs.label: .NET Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of the .NET Framework that is loaded by this application pool. If the applications assigned to this application pool do not contain managed code, select the No Managed Code option from the list.

inputs.name: PipeLineMode
inputs.label: Managed Pipeline Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Managed pipeline mode specifies how IIS processes requests for managed content. Use classic mode only when the applications in the application pool cannot run in the Integrated mode.

inputs.name: AppPoolIdentity
inputs.label: Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the account under which an application pool's worker process runs. Select one of the predefined security accounts or configure a custom account.

inputs.name: AppPoolPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you are using a gMSA, this is not required.

inputs.name: AppCmdCommands
inputs.label: Additional AppCmd.exe Commands
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Additional AppCmd.exe commands to set website or application pool properties. For more than one command use line separator, e.g.,
list apppools
list sites

inputs.name: DeployInParallel
inputs.label: Deploy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will deploy the Web application in-parallel on the target machines.

inputs.name: ResourceFilteringMethod
inputs.label: Select Machines By
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally, select a subset of machines either by providing machine names or tags.

inputs.name: MachineFilter
inputs.label: Deploy to Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: This input is valid only for machine groups and is not supported for flat list of machines or output variables yet. Provide a list of machines like, dbserver.fabrikam.com, webserver.fabrikam.com, 192.168.12.34, or tags like, Role:DB; OS:Win8.1. If multiple tags are provided, then the task will run in all the machines with the specified tags. For Azure Resource Groups, provide the virtual machine's name like, ffweb, ffdb. The default is to run the task in all machines.

value.name: cURLUploader
value.description: Use cURL to upload files with FTP, FTPS, SFTP, HTTP, and more.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: files
inputs.label: Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: File(s) to be uploaded. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**\*.zip` for all ZIP files in all subfolders.

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the username for server authentication.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the password for server authentication. Use a new build variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: url
inputs.label: URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the URL to where the file(s) will be uploaded. The directory should end with a trailing slash. Possible URL protocols include `DICT://`, `FILE://`, `FTP://`, `FTPS://`, `GOPHER://`, `HTTP://`, `HTTPS://`, `IMAP://`, `IMAPS://`, `LDAP://`, `LDAPS://`, `POP3://`, `POP3S://`, `RTMP://`, `RTSP://`, `SCP://`, `SFTP://`, `SMTP://`, `SMTPS://`, `TELNET://` and `TFTP://`.

inputs.name: options
inputs.label: Optional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments that will be passed to cURL.

inputs.name: redirectStderr
inputs.label: Redirect Standard Error to Standard Out
inputs.helpMarkDown: Adds '--stderr -' as an argument to cURL. By default, cURL writes its progress bar to stderr, which is interpreted by the build as error output. Enabling this checkbox suppresses that behavior.

value.name: cURLUploader
value.description: Use cURL to upload files with FTP, FTPS, SFTP, HTTP, and more.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: files
inputs.label: Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: File(s) to be uploaded. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/*.zip` for all ZIP files in all subfolders.

inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The service connection with the credentials for the server authentication. Use the Generic service connection type for the service connection.

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the username for server authentication.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the password for server authentication. Use a new build variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: url
inputs.label: URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the URL to where the file(s) will be uploaded. The directory should end with a trailing slash. Possible URL protocols include `DICT://`, `FILE://`, `FTP://`, `FTPS://`, `GOPHER://`, `HTTP://`, `HTTPS://`, `IMAP://`, `IMAPS://`, `LDAP://`, `LDAPS://`, `POP3://`, `POP3S://`, `RTMP://`, `RTSP://`, `SCP://`, `SFTP://`, `SMTP://`, `SMTPS://`, `TELNET://` and `TFTP://`.

inputs.name: remotePath
inputs.label: Remote Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: If supplied, this is the sub-folder on the remote server for the URL supplied in the credentials.

inputs.name: options
inputs.label: Optional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments that will be passed to cURL.

inputs.name: redirectStderr
inputs.label: Redirect Standard Error to Standard Out
inputs.helpMarkDown: Adds '--stderr -' as an argument to cURL. By default, cURL writes its progress bar to stderr, which is interpreted by the build as error output. Enabling this checkbox suppresses that behavior.

outputVariables.name: provisioningProfileUuid
outputVariables.description: The UUID property for the selected provisioning profile.

outputVariables.name: provisioningProfileName
outputVariables.description: The Name property for the selected provisioning profile.

value.name: InstallAppleProvisioningProfile
value.description: Install an Apple provisioning profile required to build on a macOS agent
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: provisioningProfileLocation
inputs.label: Provisioning profile location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the location of the provisioning profile to install. The provisioning profile can be uploaded to `Secure Files` or stored in your source repository or a local path on the agent.

inputs.name: provProfileSecureFile
inputs.label: Provisioning profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the provisioning profile that was uploaded to `Secure Files` to install on the macOS agent.

inputs.name: provProfileSourceRepository
inputs.label: Provisioning profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the provisioning profile from the source repository or specify the local path to a provisioning profile on the macOS agent.

inputs.name: removeProfile
inputs.label: Remove profile after build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to specify that the provisioning profile should be removed from the agent after the build or release is complete.

value.name: InstallAppleProvisioningProfile
value.description: Install an Apple provisioning profile required to build on a macOS agent
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: provProfileSecureFile
inputs.label: Provisioning Profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the provisioning profile that was uploaded to `Secure Files` to install on the macOS agent.

inputs.name: removeProfile
inputs.label: Remove Profile After Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to specify that the provisioning profile should be removed from the agent after the build or release is complete.

value.name: npmAuthenticate
value.description: Don't use this task if you're also using the npm task. Provides npm credentials to an .npmrc file in your repository for the scope of the build. This enables npm task runners like Gulp and Grunt to authenticate with private registries.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: workingFile
inputs.label: .npmrc file to authenticate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the .npmrc file that specifies the registries you want to work with. Select the file, not the folder e.g. "/packages/mypackage.npmrc".

inputs.name: customEndpoint
inputs.label: Credentials for registries outside this account/collection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Credentials to use for external registries located in the project's .npmrc. For registries in this account/collection, leave this blank; the builds credentials are used automatically.

value.name: Maven
value.description: Build with Apache Maven
value.releaseNotes: Configuration of the SonarQube analysis was moved to the [SonarQube](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarqube) or [SonarCloud](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarcloud) extensions, in task `Prepare Analysis Configuration`
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: mavenPOMFile
inputs.label: Maven POM file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the Maven POM file.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to TFS/Team Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Maven build to TFS/Team Services. Each test results file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in TFS/Team Services.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path and pattern of test results files to publish. Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)). For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with `TEST-`. If no root path is specified, files are matched beneath the default working directory, the value of which is available in the variable: $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).  For example, a value of '**/TEST-*.xml' will actually result in matching files from '$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/**/TEST-*.xml'.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: codeCoverageTool
inputs.label: Code coverage tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the code coverage tool.

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class inclusion/exclusion filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example: +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field is required for a multi-module project. Specify a comma-separated list of relative paths from the Maven POM file to directories containing class files and archive files (JAR, WAR, etc.). Code coverage is reported for class files in these directories. For example: target/classes,target/testClasses.

inputs.name: srcDirectories
inputs.label: Source files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field is required for a multi-module project. Specify a comma-separated list of relative paths from the Maven POM file to source code directories. Code coverage reports will use these to highlight source code. For example: src/java,src/Test.

inputs.name: failIfCoverageEmpty
inputs.label: Fail when code coverage results are missing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if code coverage did not produce any results to publish.

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of the JDK.

inputs.name: mavenVersionSelection
inputs.label: Maven version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Uses either the default Maven version or the version in the specified custom path.

inputs.name: mavenPath
inputs.label: Maven path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Supply the custom path to the Maven installation (e.g., /usr/share/maven).

inputs.name: mavenSetM2Home
inputs.label: Set M2_HOME variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets the M2_HOME variable to a custom Maven installation path.

inputs.name: mavenOpts
inputs.label: Set MAVEN_OPTS to
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets the MAVEN_OPTS environment variable, which is used to send command-line arguments to start the JVM. The -Xmx flag specifies the maximum memory available to the JVM.

inputs.name: mavenFeedAuthenticate
inputs.label: Authenticate built-in Maven feeds
inputs.helpMarkDown: Automatically authenticate built-in Maven feeds from the VSTS/TFS [Package Management](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms.feed) extension. If built-in Maven feeds are not in use, deselect this option for faster builds.

inputs.name: sqAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run SonarQube or SonarCloud analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option has changed from version 1 of the **Maven** task to use the [SonarQube](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarqube) and [SonarCloud](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarcloud) marketplace extensions.  Enable this option to run [SonarQube or SonarCloud analysis](http://redirect.sonarsource.com/doc/install-configure-scanner-tfs-ts.html) after executing goals in the **Goals** field. The **install** or **package** goal should run first. You must also add a **Prepare Analysis Configuration** task from one of the extensions to the build pipeline before this Maven task.

options.pom: Use version declared in your pom.xml

inputs.name: sqMavenPluginVersionChoice
inputs.label: SonarQube scanner for Maven version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube Maven plugin version to use. You can use latest version, or rely on the version in your pom.xml.

inputs.name: checkstyleAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run Checkstyle
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the Checkstyle tool with the default Sun checks. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: pmdAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run PMD
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the PMD static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: findbugsAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run FindBugs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the FindBugs static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: sqConnectedServiceName

inputs.name: sqProjectName

inputs.name: sqProjectKey

inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube project unique key, i.e. sonar.projectKey.

inputs.name: sqProjectVersion
inputs.label: SonarQube Project Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube project version, i.e. sonar.projectVersion.

inputs.name: sqDbDetailsRequired
inputs.label: The SonarQube server version is lower than 5.2
inputs.helpMarkDown: If using a SonarQube server 5.1 or lower, you must specify the database connection details.

inputs.name: sqDbUrl
inputs.label: Db Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only. Enter the database connection setting (i.e. sonar.jdbc.url). For example: jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://localhost/sonar;SelectMethod=Cursor

inputs.name: sqDbUsername
inputs.label: Db Username

inputs.name: sqDbPassword

inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only. Enter the password for the database user i.e. sonar.jdbc.password

inputs.name: sqAnalysisIncludeFullReport
inputs.label: Include full analysis report in the build summary (SQ 5.3+)
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option will delay the build until the SonarQube analysis is completed.

inputs.name: sqAnalysisBreakBuildIfQualityGateFailed

inputs.helpMarkDown: This option is only available when using a SonarQube server 5.3 or above. It will introduce delays as the build must wait for SonarQube to complete the analysis. [More information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=722407)

value.name: AzureMysqlDeployment
value.description: This is an early preview. Run your scripts and make changes to your Azure Database for MySQL.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown:
This is needed to connect to your Azure account.
To configure new service connection, select the Azure subscription from the list and click 'Authorize'.
If your subscription is not listed or if you want to use an existing Service Principal, you can setup an Azure service connection using 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Server name of 'Azure Database for MySQL'.Example: fabrikam.mysql.database.azure.com. When you connect using MySQL Workbench, this is the same value that is used for 'Hostname' in 'Parameters'

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of database, if you already have one, on which the below script is needed to be run, else the script itself can be used to create the database.

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: Server Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Database for MySQL server supports native MySQL authentication. You can connect and authenticate to a server with the server's admin login. Example:  bbo1@fabrikam. When you connect using MySQL Workbench, this is the same value that is used for 'Username' in 'Parameters'.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for Azure Database for MySQL. In case you dont recall the password you can change the password from [Azure portal](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/mysql/howto-create-manage-server-portal).
It can be variable defined in the pipeline. Example : $(password).
Also, you may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: TaskNameSelector
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select one of the options between Script File & Inline Script.

inputs.name: SqlFile
inputs.label: MySQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path of the script file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like,  \\\\BudgetIT\DeployBuilds\script.sql. Also, predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here. A file containing SQL statements can be used here.

inputs.name: SqlInline
inputs.label: Inline MySQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the MySQL script to execute on the Database selected above.

inputs.name: SqlAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional MySQL Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Additional options supported by MySQL simple SQL shell. These options will be applied when executing the given file on the Azure Database for MySQL.
Example: You can change to default tab separated output format to HTML or even XML format. Or if you have problems due to insufficient memory for large result sets, use the --quick option.

inputs.name: IpDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown:
For successful execution of the task, we need to enable administrators to access the Azure Database for MySQL Server from the IP Address of the automation agent.
By selecting auto-detect you can automatically add firewall exception for range of possible IP Address of automation agent or else you can specify the range explicitly.

inputs.name: StartIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50 .

inputs.name: EndIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65 .

inputs.name: DeleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the added exception for IP addresses of the automation agent will be removed for corresponding Azure Database for MySQL.

outputVariables.name: LocalPathsForInstalledExtensions
outputVariables.description:
The local installation paths for the selected extensions for installation.
Note: In case multiple extensions are selected for installation, the output is a comma separated list of local paths for each of the selected extension in the order they appear in the Install Extensions field.

value.name: SqlAzureDacpacDeployment
value.description: Deploy Azure SQL DB using DACPAC or run scripts using SQLCMD
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Classic Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Azure Classic subscription for deploying SQL files

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Azure Resource Manager subscription for deploying SQL files

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Azure SQL Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure SQL Server name, like Fabrikam.database.windows.net,1433 or Fabrikam.database.windows.net.

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Azure SQL Database, where the files will be deployed.

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: Server Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Azure SQL Server administrator login.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for the Azure SQL Server administrator.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: DeploymentAction
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose one of the SQL Actions from the list. For more details refer link.

inputs.name: DacpacFile
inputs.label: DACPAC File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the DACPAC file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.dacpac. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.
inputs.visibleRule: TaskNameSelector = DacpacTask || DeploymentAction = Script || DeploymentAction = DeployReport

inputs.name: BacpacFile
inputs.label: BACPAC File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the BACPAC file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.bacpac. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.

inputs.name: SqlFile
inputs.label: SQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the SQL script file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.sql. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.

inputs.name: SqlInline
inputs.label: Inline SQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the SQL script to execute on the Database selected above.

inputs.name: PublishProfile
inputs.label: Publish Profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish profile provides fine-grained control over Azure SQL Database creation or upgrades. Specify the path to the Publish profile XML file on the automation agent or on a UNC share. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.buildDirectory) or $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.
inputs.visibleRule: TaskNameSelector = DacpacTask || DeploymentAction = Script || DeploymentAction = DeployReport

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional SqlPackage.exe Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional SqlPackage.exe arguments that will be applied when deploying the Azure SQL Database, in case DACPAC option is selected like, /p:IgnoreAnsiNulls=True /p:IgnoreComments=True. These arguments will override the settings in the Publish profile XML file (if provided).
inputs.visibleRule: TaskNameSelector = DacpacTask || DeploymentAction = Extract || DeploymentAction = Export || DeploymentAction = Import || DeploymentAction = Script || DeploymentAction = DeployReport || DeploymentAction = DriftReport

inputs.name: SqlAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd arguments that will be applied when executing the given SQL query on the Azure SQL Database like, -ConnectionTimeout 100 -OutputSqlErrors.

inputs.name: InlineAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd arguments that will be applied when executing the given SQL query on the Azure SQL Database like, -ConnectionTimeout 100 -OutputSqlErrors

inputs.name: IpDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: For the task to run, the IP Address of the automation agent has to be added to the 'Allowed IP Addresses' in the Azure SQL Server's Firewall. Select auto-detect to automatically add firewall exception for range of possible IP Address of automation agent or specify the range explicitly.

inputs.name: StartIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50.

inputs.name: EndIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65.

inputs.name: DeleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, then after the task ends, the IP Addresses specified here are deleted from the 'Allowed IP Addresses' list of the Azure SQL Server's Firewall.

[More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613722)

value.name: NuGetPackager
value.description: Deprecated: use the NuGet task instead. It works with the new Tool Installer framework so you can easily use new versions of NuGet without waiting for a task update, provides better support for authenticated feeds outside this account/collection, and uses NuGet 4 by default.
value.author: Lawrence Gripper

inputs.name: searchPattern
inputs.label: Path to csproj or nuspec file(s) to pack
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Pattern to search for csproj or nuspec files to pack.

You can separate multiple patterns with a semicolon, and you can make a pattern negative by prefixing it with '-:'. Example: `**\*.csproj;-:**\*.Tests.csproj`

inputs.name: outputdir
inputs.label: Package Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where packages will be created. If empty, packages will be created alongside the csproj or nuspec file.

inputs.name: includeReferencedProjects
inputs.label: Include referenced projects
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include referenced projects either as dependencies or as part of the package. Cannot be used with automatic package versioning. If a referenced project has a corresponding nuspec file that has the same name as the project, then that referenced project is added as a dependency. Otherwise, the referenced project is added as part of the package. [Learn more](https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#pack-command) at NuGet.org.

inputs.name: versionByBuild
inputs.label: Automatic package versioning
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Cannot be used with include referenced projects. If you choose 'Use the date and time', this will generate a [SemVer](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)-compliant version formatted as `X.Y.Z-ci-datetime` where you choose X, Y, and Z.

If you choose 'Use an environment variable', you must select an environment variable and ensure it contains the version number you want to use.

If you choose 'Use the build number', this will use the build number to version you package. **Note:** Under General set the build format to be '[$(BuildDefinitionName)_$(Year:yyyy).$(Month).$(DayOfMonth)$(Rev:.r)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627416)'.

inputs.name: versionEnvVar
inputs.label: Environment variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the variable name without $, $env, or %.

inputs.name: requestedMajorVersion
inputs.label: Major
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'X' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: requestedMinorVersion
inputs.label: Minor
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Y' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: requestedPatchVersion
inputs.label: Patch
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Z' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: configurationToPack
inputs.label: Configuration to Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: When using a csproj file this specifies the configuration to package

inputs.name: buildProperties
inputs.label: Additional build properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Semicolon delimited list of properties used to build the package.

inputs.name: nuGetAdditionalArgs
inputs.label: NuGet Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to NuGet.exe pack. [More Information](https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#user-content-pack-command).

inputs.name: nuGetPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to NuGet.exe

inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the target Resource Group for copying files to.

inputs.name: ResourceFilteringMethod
inputs.label: Select Machines By
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally, select a subset of VMs in resource group either by providing VMs host name or tags. [Tags](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-in/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-tagging-arm/) are supported for resources created via the Azure Resource Manager only.

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Filter Criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a list of VMs host name like ffweb, ffdb, or tags like Role:DB, Web; OS:Win8.1. Note the delimiters used for tags are ,(comma), :(colon) and ;(semicolon). If multiple tags are provided, then the task will run in all the VMs with the specified tags. The default is to run the task in all the VMs.

inputs.name: vmsAdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator Username of the VMs.

inputs.name: vmsAdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The administrator password of the VMs.
It can accept a variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark a variable as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local path on the target machines for copying the files from the source. Environment variable can be used like $env:windir\BudgetIT\Web.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when uploading to blob or uploading to VM like, /NC:10.

inputs.name: enableCopyPrerequisites
inputs.label: Enable Copy Prerequisites
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing copy operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986). Applicable only for ARM VMs.

inputs.name: CopyFilesInParallel
inputs.label: Copy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will copy files in parallel to the target machines.

inputs.name: CleanTargetBeforeCopy
inputs.label: Clean Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will clean-up the destination folder before copying the files.

inputs.name: skipCACheck
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, client skips the validation that the server certificate is signed by a trusted certificate authority (CA) when connecting over Hypertext Transfer Protocol over Secure Socket Layer (HTTPS).

inputs.name: outputStorageUri
inputs.label: Storage Container URI
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the variable for the storage container URI that the files were copied to with this task.  Valid only when the selected destination is Azure Blob.

inputs.name: outputStorageContainerSasToken
inputs.label: Storage Container SAS Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the variable for the storage container SAS Token used to access the files copied to with this task.  Valid only when the selected destination is Azure Blob.

value.name: AzureFileCopy
value.description: Copy files to Azure blob or VM(s)
value.releaseNotes:
What's new in Version 2.0:
   Using newer version of AzCopy.
value.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: SourcePath
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path of the source folder, or file on the local machine, or a UNC share. Expression should return a single folder or a file.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Classic Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic subscription to target for copying the files.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to target for copying the files.

inputs.name: Destination
inputs.label: Destination Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the destination, either Azure Blob or Azure VMs.

inputs.name: StorageAccount
inputs.label: Classic Storage Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a pre-existing classic storage account. It is also used as an intermediary for copying files to Azure VMs

inputs.name: StorageAccountRM
inputs.label: RM Storage Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a pre-existing ARM storage account. It is also used as an intermediary for copying files to Azure VMs

inputs.name: ContainerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Container for uploading the files. Default is to create a container automatically.

inputs.name: BlobPrefix
inputs.label: Blob Prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: Useful for filtering files, for example, append build number to all the blobs to download files from that build only.

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Cloud Service
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the target Cloud Service for copying files to.

inputs.name: EnvironmentNameRM
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the target Resource Group for copying files to.

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForBlobCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for uploading files to blob)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when uploading to blob like, /NC:10. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
/Y, /SetContentType, /Z, /V,
/S (only if container name is not $root),
/BlobType:page (only if specified storage account is a premium account).
If source path is a file, /Pattern will always be added irrespective of whether or not you have specified optional arguments.

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForVMCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for downloading files to VM)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when downloading to VM like, /NC:10. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
/Y, /S, /Z, /V
